enumeratio: <entryFree id="n15854" type="main" key="e_nu^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nŭmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enumero</etym>, <sense id="n15854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumerating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15854.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum et malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15854.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhetor. lang., <hi rend="ital">a recapitulation</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nakefalai/wsis</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1 al" default="NO">6, 1, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
enumero: <entryFree id="n15855" type="main" key="e_nu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reckon up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count out</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15855.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne enumerasti id, quod ad te rediturum putes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: dies, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to rate</tr>, <tr>estimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <trans><tr>to count out</tr>, <tr>to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15855.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to enumerate in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">enumerare possum, quae sit in figuris animantium descriptio partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos et domitas gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:719" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera, oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit> (with narrare): <cit><quote lang="la">plurima fando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem meorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineos coetus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juniam familiam a stirpe ad hanc aetatem ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne de eodem plura enumerando defatigemus lectores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enunciatio: <entryFree id="n15856" type="main" key="e_nunci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuncĭātĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enunciativus</orth>, etc., v. enunt-.</entryFree>
enundino: <entryFree id="n15857" type="main" key="e_nundi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nundĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> (eccl. Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: Spiritum Sanctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enuntiatio: <entryFree id="n15858" type="main" key="e_nunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enunciat-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enuntio</etym>, in rhetor. and dialect. lang., <sense id="n15858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enunciation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO">9, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enuntiativus: <entryFree id="n15859" type="main" key="e_nunti^a_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntĭātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enunciat-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declarative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enunciative</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 12 sq.</bibl>—As gram. t. t. = <foreign lang="greek">a)paggeltiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picturesque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus poëmatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 479</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
enuntiator: <entryFree id="n15860" type="main" key="e_nunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a revealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declarer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Qu. in Heptat. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enuntiatrix: <entryFree id="n15861" type="main" key="e_nunti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntĭātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enunciat-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n15861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">she who enounces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declares</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars (rhetorice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: sensuum (lingua), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 771.</sense></entryFree>
enuntiatum: <entryFree id="n15862" type="main" key="e_nunti^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntĭātum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enunciat-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proposition;</hi> v. enuntio, II.</sense></entryFree>
enuntio: <entryFree id="n15863" type="main" key="e_nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enuncio</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say out</hi> (esp. something that should be kept secret), <hi rend="ital">to divulge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15863.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quod meae concreditumst taciturnitati clam, ne enuntiarem, quoiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum consilia adversariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Helvetiis per indicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum Ciceroni per Fulviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 206</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 35</bibl>; Caes, B. G. 1, 31, 2; 5, 58, 1 et saep.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 66</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15863.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to speak out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi> (for the most part only in Cic. and Quint. in the rhetor., dialect., and gram. signif.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum inflexo commentatoque verbo res eadem enuntiatur ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias breviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscena nudis nominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:62" default="NO">8, 3, 62</bibl>: fundamentum dialecticae est, quicquid enuntietur (id autem appellant <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/wma</foreign>, quod est quasi effatum) aut verum esse, aut falsum, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Cf. in the <hi rend="ital">part. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuntiā-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi>, = enuntiatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>, and 12, 28.—</sense><sense id="n15863.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litterae) quae scribuntur aliter quam enuntiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO">1, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:4 al" default="NO">2, 11, 4 al.</bibl>: masculino genere cor, ut multa alia, enuntiavit Ennius, Caesell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enuptio: <entryFree id="n15864" type="hapax" key="e_nupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnuptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enubo</etym>, <sense id="n15864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marrying out of one family into another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 19, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
enutrio: <entryFree id="n15865" type="main" key="e_nu_tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nūtrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15865.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum sub antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae lutense genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 131</bibl></cit>: platanum, id. <cb n="EO" /> 12, 1, 4, § 8.—</sense><sense id="n15865.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to promote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde origines aedificiorum sint institutae, et quibus rationibus enutritae et progressae sint gradatim ad hanc finitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enutritio: <entryFree id="n15866" type="main" key="e_nu_tri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnūtrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enutrio</etym>, <sense id="n15866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 4</bibl></cit> ad 24, 19.</sense></entryFree>
enyo: <entryFree id="n15867" type="main" key="Eny_o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Enȳō</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)enuw/</foreign>, <sense id="n15867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of war</hi>, pure Lat. Bellona (only in post-Aug. poets). </sense><sense id="n15867.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:203" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:657" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 657</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 24:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 24, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eo: <entryFree id="n15868" type="main" key="e^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii</itype> (īt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:418 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 418 al.</bibl>; cf. <sense id="n15868.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 206 sq.: isse, issem, etc., for ivisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 350</bibl> et saep.: isti, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 834</bibl></cit>, etc., v. Neue Formenl. 2, 515), īre (<hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> irier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 16</bibl>), <itype>ĭtum</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root i-, Sanscr. ēmi, go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)=mi</foreign>; causat. <foreign lang="greek">i(/hmi</foreign> = jacio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 403" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 403</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> (of every kind of motion of animate or inanimate things), <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, etc. (very freq. in all periods and sorts of writing). </sense><sense id="n15868.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15868.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 71</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos priores ibimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i in crucem,</quote> <trans><tr>go and be hanged!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">i in malam crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i in malam rem hinc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iens in Pompeianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidio suis ierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom it dormitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; id Most. 3, 2, 4; 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 119</bibl> et saep, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dormitum, lusum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with the <case>acc.</case> of the terminus: <cit><quote lang="la">ibis Cecropios portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 125</bibl></cit> Loers.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardoos recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:368" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 368</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Afros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—With a cognate <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompam funeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:663" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 663</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non explorantur eundae vitandaeque viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae ad lumen iturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ire in Piraeum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visere ad aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire pedibus,</quote> <trans><tr>on foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in raeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with equis to be supplied,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum classe Pisas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">concedere quo poterunt undae, cum pisces ire nequibunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 380</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.3" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus non it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:7" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates jam mollior undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor per artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucus in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum (with volare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 971</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give way</tr>, <tr>sink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 564</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in semen ire (asparagum),</quote> <trans><tr>to go to seed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 159</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in corpus (juvenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis it in sucos,</quote> <trans><tr>turns into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 493</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15868.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed against</hi> with hostile intent, <hi rend="ital">to march against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fugere credebant, infestis signis ad se ire viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 424</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium,</quote> <trans><tr>to go against</tr>, <tr>to attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.6" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe hominem paulatim cernimus ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 526</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 530</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:594" default="NO" valid="yes">594</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n15868.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15868.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire in opus alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dubiam imperii servitiique aleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alteram causam praeceps ierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rixam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 413</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:193" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 668</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ire per singula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:64" default="NO">7, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21" default="NO">10, 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem (modum) non per gradus itur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite qua sit eundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire infitias, v. infitiae: Latina debent cito pariter ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae contradictiones eunt interim longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 54</bibl></cit>: in eosdem semper pedes ire (compositio),<pb n="649" /> <cb n="EO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per omnes et personas et affectus eat (comoedia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygiae per oppida facti Rumor it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">it clamor caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factoque in secula ituro, Laetantur tribuisse locum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go down to posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:312" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 312</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with a subject-sentence: ibit in saecula, fuisse principem, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15868.10" n="1" level="3"> Pub. law t. t. </sense><sense id="n15868.11" n="a" level="4"> Pedibus ire, or simply ire in aliquam sententiam, in voting, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accede to any opinion</hi> (opp. discedere, v. h. v. II. B. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes in sententiam ejus pedibus irent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars major eorum qui aderant in eandem sententiam ibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:43" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam sententiam cum pedibus iretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibatur in eam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itum in sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 48</bibl>.—And opp. to the above, </sense><sense id="n15868.12" n="b" level="4"> Ire in alia omnia, <hi rend="ital">to vote against a bill</hi>, v. alius, II.—</sense><sense id="n15868.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg> for vēneo, <hi rend="ital">to go for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sold at</hi> a certain price, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot Pontus eat, tot Lydia nummis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.14" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">it dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anni more fluentis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15868.15" n="4" level="3"> With the accessory notion of result, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipit res melius ire quam putaram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus ibat res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam omnia fatis Caesaris ire videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 144</bibl></cit>.—Hence the wish: sic eat, <hi rend="ital">so may he fare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic eat quaecunque Romana lugebit hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 297</bibl> Cort.; 2, 304; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 155</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15868.16" n="5" level="3"> Constr. with a supine, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/llein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be about</hi> to do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si opulentus it petitum pauperioris gratiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 36</bibl>: quod uti prohibitum irem, quod in me esset, meo labori non parsi, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. PARSI, p. 242 Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">perditum gentem universam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultum injurias, scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitum Grais matribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 786</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum praemia ereptum eunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence the construction of the <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> iri with the supine, in place of an <hi rend="ital">inf. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi omne argentum redditum iri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi istaec videtur praeda praedatum irier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu pontum carpere remis Ibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollere facta regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:61 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 61 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15868.17" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imp.</hi> i, eas, eat, etc., since the Aug. period more freq. a mocking or indignant expression, <hi rend="ital">go then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i nunc et cupidi nomen amantis habe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">i nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 127</bibl></cit>; 9, 105; 17, 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29, 22</bibl> (3, 27, 22 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:306 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 306 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i, sequere Italiam ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 381</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">i,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremunt omnibus locis: Irent, crearent consules ex plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15869" type="main" key="e^o_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> form of <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> stem i; cf. is</etym>. <sense id="n15869.0" n="I" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">locat.</hi> and <case>abl.</case> uses, </sense><sense id="n15869.1" n="A" level="2"> Of place=in eo loco, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that place</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid (facturus est) cum tu eo quinque legiones haberes?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo loco ... ibi ... eoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 136</bibl>; so trop.: eo loci, <hi rend="ital">in that condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res erat eo jam loci, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 13, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:52:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 52, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15869.2" n="B" level="2"> Of cause=eā re. </sense><sense id="n15869.3" n="1" level="3"> Referring to a cause or reason before given, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for that reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is nunc dicitur venturus peregre: eo nunc commenta est dolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederam litteras ad te: eo nunc ero brevior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 2, 3</bibl> et saep.—So with <hi rend="ital">conjunctions</hi>, eoque, et eo, eo quoque, in adding any thing as a consequence of what precedes, <hi rend="ital">and for that reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolute pares, et eo quoque innumerabiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditius eoque hostibus incautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per gentes integras et eo feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 42 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n15869.4" n="2" level="3"> Referring to a foll. clause, giving </sense><sense id="n15869.5" n="(a)" level="5"> a cause or reason, with quia, quoniam, quod, etc.; so with <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo fit, quia mihi plurimum credo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 124</bibl></cit>; id. <cb n="EO" /> Capt. 1, 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc eo videtur foedus, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia scripseras, eo te censebam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eo notavi, quoniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ... non potueritis, eo vobis potestas erepta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo ... quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15869.6" n="(b)" level="5"> A purpose, motive or reason, with quo, ut, ne; and after negatives, with quo, quin, and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>—So with <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo scripsi, quo plus auctoritatis haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non eo ... quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo ... quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 51</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eo scripsi, ut intellegeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 5, 9</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego non eo vereor, ne mihi noceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 9</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eo haec dico, quin quae tu vis ego velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15869.7" n="C" level="2"> Of measure or degree—with words of comparison, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by so much</hi>—followed by <hi rend="ital">quo</hi> (= tanto ... quanto): <cit><quote lang="la">quae eo fructuosiores fiunt, quo calidior terra aratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo gravior est dolor, quo culpa major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 1</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">quantum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum juniores patrum plebi se magis insinuabant, eo acrius contra tribuni tendebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto longius abscederent, eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 23</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq. the formulae, eo magis, eo minus, <hi rend="ital">so much the worse</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the less</hi>), followed by quo, quod, quoniam, si, ut, ne: <cit><quote lang="la">eo magis, quo tanta penuria est in omni honoris gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo minus veritus navibus, quod in littore molli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo magis, quoniam, etc., Cels. praef. p. 14, 12 Müll.: nihil admirabilius fieri potest, eoque magis, si ea sunt in adulescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo diligentius ut ne parvula quidem titubatione impediremur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illa extuli et eo quidem magis, ne quid ille superiorum meminisse me putaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In this combination eo often expresses also the idea of cause (cf. B. 1. supra): hoc probis pretiumst. Eo mihi magis lubet cum probis potius quam cum improbis vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: solliciti tamen et anxii sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">eoque magis, quod se ipsi continent et coercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and some passages may be classed under either head: dederam triduo ante litteras ad te. Eo nunc ero brevior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n15869.8" n="II" level="1"> In <case>dat.</case> uses. </sense><sense id="n15869.9" n="A" level="2"> With the idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">to that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thither</hi> (=in eum locum): <cit><quote lang="la">eo se recipere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti eo cum introeas, circumspicias, uti inde exire possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo tela conicere, Auct. B. Afr. 72: eo respicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">followed by quo, ubi, unde: non potuit melius pervenirier eo, quo nos volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio nunc eo, quo me fides ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibit eo quo vis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venit) eo, ubi non modo res erat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, unde discedere non oportuit, revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (late Lat.) with loci: perducendum eo loci, ubi actum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:11:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 11, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 2, 3, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15869.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15869.11" n="1" level="3"> With the idea of addition, <hi rend="ital">thereto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in addition to that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessit eo, ut milites ejus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15869.12" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of tendency, <hi rend="ital">to that end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with that purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to this result</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem eo spectabat, ut eam a Philippo corruptam diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eo pertinet oratio, ut ipsa virtus se sustentare posse videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc eo valebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15869.13" n="3" level="3"> With the idea of degree or extent, <hi rend="ital">to that degree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo scientiae progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam res publica eo magnificentiae venerit, gliscere singulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo magnitudinis procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam eo consuetudinis adducta res est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes">28</bibl>, <cb n="EPAN" /> 27, 12; 32, 18, 8 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo insolentiae processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo rerum ventum erat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:35" default="NO">7, 1, 35</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:12" default="NO">2, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">9: eo rem jam adducam, ut nihil divinationis opus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eo est deducta, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15869.14" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">up to the time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so long</hi>, usually with usque, and followed by dum, donec: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo premere capita, dum illae captum amitterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque flagitatus est, donec ad exitium dederetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque vivere, donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO">4, 30, 4</bibl>.—Rarely by quamdiu: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque, quamdiu ad fines barbaricos veniretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eoad: <entryFree id="n15870" type="hapax" key="e^o_a^d"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕōăd</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>inverted from adeo; cf. quoad</etym>, <sense id="n15870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">until</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias eludit, eoad dum puerorum avus fato concessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 68, p. 318, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. adeo, I. A. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
eodem: <entryFree id="n15871" type="main" key="e^o_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕōdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> of idem</etym>, of place. <sense id="n15871.0" n="I" level="1"> Of the place in which, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> loci, <hi rend="ital">in the same place</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">res eodem est loci quo reliquisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">additi eodem (i. e. in Aventino) novi cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arduum est eodem loci potentiam et concordiam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15871.1" n="II" level="1"> Of the place to which. </sense><sense id="n15871.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To the same place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the same point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orgetorix omnes clientes obaeratosque suos eodem conduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pol te redigam eodem unde ortus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem accedit servitus, sudor, sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 8, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15871.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15871.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To the same thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the same point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si accedit eodem, ut tenuis antea fueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit eodem volgi voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem pertinet quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15871.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To the same person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodemque honores poenasque congeri, i. e. in eundem civem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodemque adjungas quos natura putes asperos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eon: <entryFree id="n15872" type="greek" key="eon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 39, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eopse: <entryFree id="n15873" type="main" key="e^o_pse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕōpse</orth>, v. ipse <sense id="n15873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eos: <entryFree id="n15874" type="main" key="E_o_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēōs</orth> (only in <case>nom.</case>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hw/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dawn</hi> (pure Lat. Aurora), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:877" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 877</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 615" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 615</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15874.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the East</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Orient</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 544</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15874.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ē^ōus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n15874.3" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15874.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the morning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morning-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlantides absconduntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disappear</tr>, <tr>set in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 221</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n15874.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the east</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eastern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orient</hi> (a favorite word of the Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">domus Aurorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 10, 8 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Arabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:51" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 140</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:466" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 466</bibl></cit>; 5, 557 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15874.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ē^ōus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n15874.7" n="1" level="3"> Like <foreign lang="greek">h)w=|os</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the morning-star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 588</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15874.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An inhabitant of the East</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an Oriental</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 22</bibl> Jahn; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 15, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:43 sq" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 43 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15874.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of one of the horses of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epactae: <entryFree id="n15875" type="greek" key="e^pactae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpactae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)paktai/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">h(me/rai</foreign>), <sense id="n15875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intercalary days</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 6, 17, 29</bibl> and 31.</sense></entryFree>
epagoge: <entryFree id="n15876" type="greek" key="e^pa^go_ge"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpăgōge</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pagwgh/</foreign>, rhet. t. t. = inductio, <sense id="n15876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">induction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Fig. O. 26, p. 215</bibl> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
epalimma: <entryFree id="n15877" type="gloss" key="epalimma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">epalimma</orth> <itype>genus vilissimi unguenti</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 15</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
epaminondas: <entryFree id="n15878" type="main" key="E^pa^mi_no_ndas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpămīnōndas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epameinw/ndas</foreign>, <sense id="n15878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the famous general of the Thebans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victor at Leuctra and Mantinea</hi>, Nep. Epam.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epanadiplosis: <entryFree id="n15879" type="greek" key="e^pa^na^diplo_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpănădiplōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)panadi/plwsis</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repetition of the same word</hi>, Rufin. de Schem. § 9, p. 233 Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
epanaphora: <entryFree id="n15880" type="greek" key="e^pa^na^pho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpănăphŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)panafora/</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repetition of the same word at the beginning of several successive clauses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. Lex. 6, p. 231 al.</bibl> <pb n="650" /> <cb n="EPHI" /></sense></entryFree>
epanodus: <entryFree id="n15881" type="greek" key="e^pa^no^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpănŏdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pa/nodos</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a return to the same word</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. Lex. 19, p. 241 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epanorthosis: <entryFree id="n15882" type="greek" key="e^pa^northo_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpănorthōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pano/rqwsis</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a correction of one's self in speaking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. 15, p. 238 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epaphaeresis: <entryFree id="n15883" type="greek" key="e^pa^phaere^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpăphaerĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pafai/resis</foreign>, <sense id="n15883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repeated removal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 24, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epaphroditus: <entryFree id="n15884" type="main" key="E^paphro^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpaphrŏdītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of the Emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpaphrŏdītĭānus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Epaphroditus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 68" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15884.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An eminent Christian of Philippi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epaphus: <entryFree id="n15885" type="main" key="E^pa^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*)/epafos</foreign>, <sense id="n15885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Jupiter Ammon and Io</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and builder of Memphis in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 748</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 140" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epar: <entryFree id="n15886" type="main" key="e_par"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēpar</orth>, v. hepar.</entryFree>
epastus: <entryFree id="n15887" type="hapax" key="e_pastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-pastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pasco], <sense id="n15887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eaten up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">escae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ependytes: <entryFree id="n15888" type="greek" key="e^pendy^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpendytes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pendu/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an outer garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hil. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epenthesis: <entryFree id="n15889" type="greek" key="e^penthe^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpenthĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pe/nqesis</foreign>, <sense id="n15889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the insertion of a letter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epeus: <entryFree id="n15890" type="main" key="E^pe_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpēus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpīus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 13</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epeio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Panopeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the contriver of the Trojan horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:825" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 825</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 108" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 108</bibl>; Plaut. l. l. and Fragm. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 38</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ephalmator: <entryFree id="n15891" type="greek" key="e^phalma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphalmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., <foreign lang="greek">e)fa/llomai</foreign> and Lat. ending ator</etym>, <sense id="n15891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tumbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dancer</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 15.</sense></entryFree>
ephebeum: <entryFree id="n15892" type="greek" key="e^phe_be_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēbēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fhbei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n15892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hall set apart for the youth in the palaestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephebia: <entryFree id="n15893" type="greek" key="e^phe_bi_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēbī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fhbei/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e)fhbi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n15893.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Puberty</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15893.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the evidences of puberty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15893.2" n="II" level="1"> = ephebeum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephebicus: <entryFree id="n15894" type="greek" key="e^phe_bi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fhbiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a youth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamyda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ephebitus: <entryFree id="n15895" type="hapax" key="e^phe_bi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēbītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ephebus</etym>, <sense id="n15895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has reached the age of adolescence</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 18</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
ephebus: <entryFree id="n15896" type="greek" key="e^phe_bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n15896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. contr.</hi> ephebūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 232</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/fhbos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male Greek youth</hi> from 18 to 20 years of age (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, adolescens, juvenis, adultus, pubes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
