D. 1, 28, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:147 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 147 al.</bibl>: is postquam excessit ex ephebis (after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)celqei=n e)c e)fh/bwn</foreign>), i. e. <hi rend="ital">after he had come to the age of manhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 24</bibl> Ruhnk. (also cited in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ephedra: <entryFree id="n15897" type="greek" key="e^phe^dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphĕdra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fe/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n15897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant horse-tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 20, § 36</bibl>.—Called, also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphĕdros</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 83, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephelis: <entryFree id="n15898" type="greek" key="e^phe_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fhli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freckles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephemeris: <entryFree id="n15899" type="greek" key="e^phe_me^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēmĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fhmeri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a day-book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ephemeris</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarius, tabulae, scriptio, acta, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 23, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 25 al.</bibl>: ephemeridas ejus vitae composuit, Treb. Poll. Gallien. 18, 6.</sense></entryFree>
ephemeron: <entryFree id="n15900" type="greek" key="e^phe_me^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphēmĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fh/meron</foreign>, <sense id="n15900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 107, § 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephesius: <entryFree id="n15901" type="main" key="E^phe^sius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphĕsius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
ephesus: <entryFree id="n15902" type="main" key="E^phe^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphĕsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/efesos</foreign>, <sense id="n15902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old and celebrated commercial city of Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple to Diana</hi>, now ruins near the village of <hi rend="ital">Ayasaluk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 131</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">102</bibl>; 4, 9, 124 et saep.—Derivv., </sense><sense id="n15902.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphĕsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ephesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans><tr>born at Ephesus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>deposited in the temple there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 105, 1</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ephesii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ephesians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 58 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ephi: <entryFree id="n15903" type="main" key="ephi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ephi</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n15903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Hebrew measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used for grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oil</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">an ephah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 36</bibl> et saep. <cb n="EPIC" /></sense></entryFree>
ephialtes: <entryFree id="n15904" type="main" key="E^phi^a_ltes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphĭāltes</orth> (Ĕphĭālta, ae, Sid. praef. Carm. 7, 25), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)efia/lths</foreign>. <sense id="n15904.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Aloeus and brother of Otus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the stormers of heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 28" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 234</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15904.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The betrayer of the Spartans at Thermopyiae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ephippiatus: <entryFree id="n15905" type="hapax" key="e^phippi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphippĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with an</hi> ephippium: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ephippium: <entryFree id="n15906" type="greek" key="e^phippi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphippĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)fi/ppion</foreign>, <sense id="n15906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a horse-cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">housing</hi> (cf. clitellae): <cit><quote lang="la">tegimen equi ad mollem vecturam paratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 108, 30</bibl></cit> (pure Lat. stragulum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; id. ap. Non. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:3 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 3 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">optat ephippia bos piger, optat arare caballus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>each envies the other's condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ephod: <entryFree id="n15907" type="main" key="ephod"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ephod</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n15907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part of the clothing of the Hebrew priest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ephorus: <entryFree id="n15908" type="main" key="e^pho^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n15908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> ephoroe = <foreign lang="greek">e)/foroi</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 41</bibl>, ext. 8), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/foros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a member of a well-known body of Spartan magistrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Ephori</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15909" type="main" key="E^pho^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/eforos</foreign>, <sense id="n15909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek historian of Cumae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Isocrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:87 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 87 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ephyra: <entryFree id="n15910" type="main" key="E^phy^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyra</orth>, <itype>ae, and</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyre</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)efu/ra</foreign>, Ion. <foreign lang="greek">*)efu/rh</foreign>, <sense id="n15910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for Corinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 240</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so named, according to the myth, after a sea-nymph, Ephyre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 343</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 275" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 275</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15910.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15910.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyrēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ephyrean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Corinthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 464</bibl></cit>; cf. Corinthus, II. A. 6.—</sense><sense id="n15910.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyraeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:253" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 253</bibl></cit>: moenia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Syracuse</hi> (a colony of Corinth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:180" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 180</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:52" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also Dyrrachium (founded by the Corinthian Corcyraeans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15910.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphy-rēïădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Ephyrean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Corinthian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:652" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 652</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15910.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕphyrēïas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ephyrean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Corinthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Bell. Get. 629</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epibata: <entryFree id="n15911" type="greek" key="e^pi^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)piba/ths</foreign> (<sense id="n15911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who mounts</hi>). </sense><sense id="n15911.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rider of a camel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. p. 10" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. p. 10</bibl> b.—</sense><sense id="n15911.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soldier on board a ship</hi> (pure Lat. classiarius miles), Auct. B. Alex. 11, 4; Auct. B. Afr. 20, 1; 62, 1; 63, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epibole: <entryFree id="n15912" type="greek" key="e^pi^bo^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭbŏle</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pibolh/</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accumulation of similar words</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:de Fig. 7, p. 24" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> de Fig. 7, p. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicactis: <entryFree id="n15913" type="greek" key="epicactis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">epicactis</orth>, v. epipactis.</entryFree>
epicedion: <entryFree id="n15914" type="greek" key="e^pi^ce_di_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcēdīon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pikh/deion</foreign>, <sense id="n15914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funeral song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl> and 5 <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epicertomesis: <entryFree id="n15915" type="greek" key="e^pi^certo^me_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcertŏmēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pikerto/mhsis</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sneer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sarcasm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Fig. 1, p. 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicharmus: <entryFree id="n15916" type="main" key="E^pi^charmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭcharmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/xarmos</foreign>. <sense id="n15916.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Pythagorean philosopher and comic poet of Cos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who resided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after his early youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Syracuse</hi> (whence his surname of Siculus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:89 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 89 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15916.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Epicharmīum</orth> <itype>illud, a saying of Epicharmus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15916.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a poem by Ennius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; v. Vahlen, Ennianae Poesis Reliquiae, p. 167 sq.</sense></entryFree>
epichirema: <entryFree id="n15917" type="greek" key="e^pi^chi_re_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭchīrēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pixei/rhma</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of argument</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syllogism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:5 al" default="NO">5, 14, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epichysis: <entryFree id="n15918" type="greek" key="e^pi^chy^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭchysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/xusis</foreign>, <sense id="n15918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for pouring out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=124" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 124</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicitharisma: <entryFree id="n15919" type="greek" key="e^pi^ci^tha^risma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcĭthărisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pikiqa/risma</foreign>, <sense id="n15919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the music after the play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the finale</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epiclerus: <entryFree id="n15920" type="greek" key="E^picle_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpiclērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/klhros</foreign>, <sense id="n15920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">An Only Daughter and Heiress</hi>, title of a comedy of Menander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epiclintae: <entryFree id="n15921" type="greek" key="e^piclintae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpiclintae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pikli/ntai</foreign>, <sense id="n15921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earthquakes that move with a horizontal motion</hi>, App. de Mundo, 65, 23. <cb n="EPID" /></sense></entryFree>
epicoenus: <entryFree id="n15922" type="greek" key="e^pi^coenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcœnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/koinos</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n15922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of both genders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epicene</hi> (pure Lat. promiscuus): genus, Don. p. 1746 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicopus: <entryFree id="n15923" type="greek" key="e^pi^co_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcōpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/kwpos</foreign>, <sense id="n15923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with oars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaselus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
epicrates: <entryFree id="n15924" type="main" key="E^pi_cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpīcrătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epikrath/s</foreign>. <sense id="n15924.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The victorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme;</hi> so Cicero names Pompey, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15924.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhetorician of Athens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15924.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A native of Agyrium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicrocum: <entryFree id="n15925" type="greek" key="e^pi_^cro^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpī^crŏcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/krokon</foreign> (v. Lid. and Scott sub h. v.), <sense id="n15925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transparent garment worn by women</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 53</bibl> Müll.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 318, 25</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 13</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n15925.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epictetus: <entryFree id="n15926" type="main" key="E^picte_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpictētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/kthtos</foreign>, <sense id="n15926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Stoic philosopher of Hierapolis in Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epicurus: <entryFree id="n15927" type="main" key="E^pi^cu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭcūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/kouros</foreign>, <sense id="n15927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the famous Greek philosopher of Gargettus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the author of the Epicurean philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called after him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which assumed pleasure to be the highest good</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl> et saep.—Deriv., </sense><sense id="n15927.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭcūrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Epicurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Epicurean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta doloris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 8</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭcūrēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents of the Epicurean philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Epicureans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 18</bibl> et saep.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicus: <entryFree id="n15928" type="greek" key="e^pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)piko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">epic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta (Ennius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the epic poets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epicyclus: <entryFree id="n15929" type="greek" key="e^pi^cy_^clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭcȳ^clus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/kuklos</foreign>, <sense id="n15929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small circle having its centre on the circumference of a greater circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an epicycle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 879</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidamnus: <entryFree id="n15930" type="main" key="E^pi^damnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdamnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*epi/damnos</foreign>, <sense id="n15930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an older name of Dyrrachium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 33, 49; 51; 72 al.—</sense><sense id="n15930.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15930.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdamnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Epidamnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15930.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdamnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">cives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 32; 57.</sense></entryFree>
epidaphna: <entryFree id="n15931" type="main" key="E^pi^daphna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaphna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaph-nes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 21, 18, § 79</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)epida/fnh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)epi\ *da/fnhs</foreign> (i. e. near the village of Daphne), <sense id="n15931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for Antioch on the Orontes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidaurum: <entryFree id="n15932" type="main" key="E^pi^daurum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaurum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a colonial city of Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>; cf. Auct. B. Alex. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epidaurus: <entryFree id="n15933" type="main" key="E^pi^daurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/dauros</foreign>. <sense id="n15933.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a famous temple of Aesculapius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pidhavro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 44 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15933.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15933.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaurĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Epidaurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Epidaurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:436" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 436</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrix Semeles, Beroe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:61" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also simply Epidaurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 723</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 21</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Epidaurii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Epidaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15933.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaurēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15933.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdaurĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15933.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Epidaurus Lĭmēra</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/dauros h( *limhra/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fortified sea-port on the eastern coast of Laconia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Palea Monemvasia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidemetica: <entryFree id="n15934" type="greek" key="e^pi^de_me_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdēmētĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pidhmhtika/</foreign>, <sense id="n15934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a payment in commutation for the liability to the quartering of troops</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 41.</sense></entryFree>
epidemus: <entryFree id="n15935" type="greek" key="e^pi^de_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/dhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n15935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">epidemic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species luis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epidermis: <entryFree id="n15936" type="greek" key="e^pi^dermis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdermis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pidermi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surface-skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cuticle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 61, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidicazomenos: <entryFree id="n15937" type="main" key="E^pi^di^ca_zo^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdĭcāzŏmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Epidicazomene</orth>,<pb n="651" /> <cb n="EPIM" />  <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>), <sense id="n15937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a Greek comedy of Apollodorus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitated by Terence in his Phormio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidicticalis: <entryFree id="n15938" type="greek" key="e^pi^di_cti^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdīctĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pideiktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a norm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">normal</hi>: terminus, Auct. de Limit. p. 250 sq. Goes.</sense></entryFree>
epidicticus: <entryFree id="n15939" type="greek" key="e^pi^di_cti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdīctĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pideiktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declamatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo epidictico genere, quod diximus proprium sophistarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit> (written as Greek, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl>; 61, 207).</sense></entryFree>
epidicus: <entryFree id="n15940" type="main" key="E^pi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy of Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken from that of a slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is one of the characters.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epidipnis: <entryFree id="n15941" type="greek" key="e^pi^di_pnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdīpnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pideipni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dessert</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidius: <entryFree id="n15942" type="main" key="E^pi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n15942.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of M. Antony and Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15942.1" n="II" level="1"> Marullus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people in the time of Caesar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79 sq.</bibl>† ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭdixis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/deizis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a specimen of acting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2620</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epidromus: <entryFree id="n15943" type="greek" key="e^pi_^dro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpī^drŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/dromos</foreign>. <sense id="n15943.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cord running up and down for opening and closing a net</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl> Schneid.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sail in the after-part of a ship</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epigenes: <entryFree id="n15944" type="main" key="E^pi^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek author</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epignomus: <entryFree id="n15945" type="main" key="E^pigno_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpignōmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a character in</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epigoni: <entryFree id="n15946" type="main" key="E^pi^go^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭgŏni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epi/gonoi</foreign>, <sense id="n15946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the After-born.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15946.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sons of the seven heroes who went together against Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 71" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as the name of a tragedy of Aeschylus, translated into Latin by Attius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15946.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The children of the soldiers of Alexander the Great by Asiatic women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
epigramma: <entryFree id="n15947" type="greek" key="e^pi^gramma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭgramma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n15947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> epigrammatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigrammatōn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:2" default="NO">1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">-matum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>), = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/gramma</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n15947.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inscription;</hi> on the base of a statue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on an offering,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on tombstones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a brand,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15947.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epigram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl> et saep.; so the Epigrammata of the poet Martial.</sense></entryFree>
epigrammatarius: <entryFree id="n15948" type="main" key="e^pi^gramma^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭgrammătārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>epigramma</etym>, <sense id="n15948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epigrammatist</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Florian. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Saturn. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epigrammaticus: <entryFree id="n15949" type="greek" key="e^pi^gramma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭgrammătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pigrammatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">epigrammatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta Martialis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ael. Ver. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epigrammation: <entryFree id="n15950" type="greek" key="e^pi^gramma^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭgrammătĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pigramma/tion</foreign>, <sense id="n15950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short epigram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll. (written by Müller as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
epigrammatista: <entryFree id="n15951" type="greek" key="e^pi^gramma^tista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭgrammătista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pigrammatisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epigrammatist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epigri: <entryFree id="n15952" type="greek" key="e^pi_^gri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpī^gri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wooden pins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pegs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 69, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epilepsia: <entryFree id="n15953" type="greek" key="e^pi^le_psia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭlēpsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pilhyi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the falling sickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epilepsy</hi>, Lat. morbus comitialis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:60 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 60 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epilepticus: <entryFree id="n15954" type="greek" key="e^pi^le_pti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭlēptĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pilhptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">epileptic</hi>, Auct. Fragm. Jur. Antejust. p. 38 ed. Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">passio = morbus comitialis,</quote> <trans><tr>epilepsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:30:162" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 30, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epileus: <entryFree id="n15955" type="greek" key="e^pi^le_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭlēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epilimma: <entryFree id="n15956" type="main" key="e^pi^limma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭlimma</orth>, v. epalimma.</entryFree>
epilogus: <entryFree id="n15957" type="greek" key="e^pi^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n15957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winding up</hi> of a speech, <hi rend="ital">peroration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epilogue</hi> (= peroratio or conclusio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO">4, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:50" default="NO">50</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
epimedion: <entryFree id="n15958" type="greek" key="e^pi^me_di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭmēdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n15958.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 53, § 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15958.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stairrail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balustrade</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3301</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epimelas: <entryFree id="n15959" type="greek" key="e^pi^me^la_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭmĕlās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pime/las</foreign>, <sense id="n15959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gem superficially black</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epimenia: <entryFree id="n15960" type="greek" key="e^pi^me_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭmēnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pimh/nia</foreign>, <sense id="n15960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provisions for a month</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a month's rations</hi> (Lat. menstrua), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 120</bibl>. <cb n="EPIS" /></sense></entryFree>
epimenides: <entryFree id="n15961" type="main" key="E^pi^me^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭmĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epimeni/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n15961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Greek poet and prophet of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 3</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:175" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 52, 53, § 175</bibl>.—Perh. named after him: genus (bulborum) Epimenidu (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">*)epimeni/dou</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 93</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epimerismos: <entryFree id="n15962" type="greek" key="e^pi^me^rismos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭmĕrismos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pimerismo/s</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the summing up of the heads of an argument</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 564</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epimetheus: <entryFree id="n15963" type="main" key="E^pi^me_theus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭmētheus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epimhqeu/s</foreign>, in the Greek mythology, <sense id="n15963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Iapetus and Clymene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Pandora</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef. 142.—Whence <hi rend="ital">his daughter Pyrrha</hi> is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpĭmēthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epimhqi/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 390</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epimetrum: <entryFree id="n15964" type="greek" key="e^pi^me_^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭmē^trum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/metron</foreign>, <sense id="n15964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is given over the measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-measure</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 15.</sense></entryFree>
epinicium: <entryFree id="n15965" type="greek" key="e^pi^ni_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭnīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pini/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n15965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song of victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 15, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15965.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a festival for victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere Hierosolymis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 8, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epinyctis: <entryFree id="n15966" type="greek" key="e^pi^nyctis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭnyctis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pinukti/s</foreign>. <sense id="n15966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Night-blains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pustules that arise in the night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n15966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sore in the eyelid;</hi> also called syce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epionicus: <entryFree id="n15967" type="greek" key="e^pi^o_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭōnĭcus</orth> versus = versus Ionicus a majore, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> de Metr. Ter. p. 1319</bibl> P.</entryFree>

R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, praef. 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 283</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achil. 1, 428</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15980.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15980.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēpīrōtēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hpeirw/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an Epirote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. R. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 53</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15980.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēpīrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Epirus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Ausspr. 2, 141; but cf. Brambach, Hülfsb. p. 35 sq. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 493 note), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pistolh/</foreign>. <sense id="n15995.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a written communication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epistle</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae, codicilli): venio nunc ad tuas litteras, quas pluribus epistolis accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 217</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam obsignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narcissus ab epistolis,</quote> <trans><tr>the secretary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. ab.—In the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae (cf. litterae), of a single letter (post-class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12:9" default="NO">11, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:5:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 5, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unis aut binis epistolis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. Jul. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15995.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an imperial letter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stating the emperor's will as law</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rescriptum, decretum, edictum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aq. 105" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aq. 105</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
epistularis: <entryFree id="n15996" type="main" key="e^pistu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpistŭlāris</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">epistol-</orth>, v. epistula <sense id="n15996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>epistula</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epistolary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15996.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <trans><tr>letter-paper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquium,</quote> <trans><tr>epistolary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Marcell. 5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Marcell. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15996.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">epistŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a messenger</hi> of the Eagle of Jupiter: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularis tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 896</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">epistulāres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">state secretaries</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 30, 7.</sense></entryFree>
epistularius: <entryFree id="n15997" type="main" key="e^pistu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpistŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = epistularis, <sense id="n15997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a letter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15997.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, ep. 22.—</sense><sense id="n15997.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">epīstŭlarĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">state secretaries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epistylium: <entryFree id="n15998" type="greek" key="e^pisty_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpistȳlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pistu/lion</foreign>, in arch., <sense id="n15998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cross-beam that rests on the columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the architrave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 96</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 11</bibl> Müll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 6</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>

epiurus: <entryFree id="n16022" type="greek" key="e^pi^u_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpĭūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/ouros</foreign>, <sense id="n16022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden pin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a peg</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epizeuxis: <entryFree id="n16023" type="greek" key="e^pi_zeuxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpīzeuxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/zeucis</foreign>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n16023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an energetic repetition of a word</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 250</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
epizygis: <entryFree id="n16024" type="greek" key="e^pi_zy^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpīzygis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pizugi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pin at the hole of the balista</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep the cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when drawn through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in its place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epodes: <entryFree id="n16025" type="greek" key="e^po^de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŏdĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:126" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epodos: <entryFree id="n16026" type="greek" key="e^po_dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpōdos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pwdo/s</foreign> (singing to), <sense id="n16026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a form of lyric metre invented by Archilochus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which a longer verse is followed by a shorter one</hi>, not including the elegiac distich. So in Roman literature, the Epodi <cb n="EPUL" /> of Horace, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2422" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2422</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 482</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epogdoos: <entryFree id="n16027" type="greek" key="e^pogdo^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpogdŏŏs</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏus</orth>, <case>acc.</case> ŏŏn or <itype>ŏum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)po/gdoos</foreign>, <sense id="n16027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a whole and an eighth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the proportion of nine to eight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epolonus: <entryFree id="n16028" type="gloss" key="epolonus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">epolonus</orth>, v. epulo <sense id="n16028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epomphalion: <entryFree id="n16029" type="greek" key="e^pompha^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpomphălĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pomfa/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n16029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaster for the uterus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
epona: <entryFree id="n16030" type="greek" key="E^po^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from equus; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppos</foreign>; but referred to root ap- of apo by Fick, Wörterb. p. 425</etym>, <sense id="n16030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the protecting goddess of horses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asses</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 402</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1792</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
epops: <entryFree id="n16031" type="greek" key="e^pops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/poy</foreign>, <sense id="n16031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hoopoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 674</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 251</bibl>; cf. upupa.</sense></entryFree>
epoptae: <entryFree id="n16032" type="greek" key="e^poptae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpoptae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)po/ptai</foreign>, <sense id="n16032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beholders; persons fully initiated into the Eleusinian mysteries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who attained the third and highest grade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that of intuition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eporedia: <entryFree id="n16033" type="main" key="E^po^re^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpŏrĕdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eporedi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n16033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman colony in Gallia Cisalpina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the district of the</hi> Salassi, <hi rend="ital">on the Duria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ivrea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eporedias: <entryFree id="n16034" type="gloss" key="eporedias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eporedias</orth> <itype>Galli bonos equorum domitores vocant</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>; cf. Epona <sense id="n16034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eporedorix: <entryFree id="n16035" type="main" key="E^po^re^do^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpŏrĕdŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)epore/doric</foreign>, Paraphr. <sense id="n16035.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A noble Aeduan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who served in Caesar's army</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 54</bibl> sq.; 7, 76.—</sense><sense id="n16035.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another Aeduan of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
epos: <entryFree id="n16036" type="greek" key="e^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpos</orth> (occurring only in the <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/pos</foreign>, <sense id="n16036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heroic poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an epic; nom.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 43</bibl>; <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:95" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epoto: <entryFree id="n16037" type="main" key="e_po_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-pōto</orth> (ex-poto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl>, <sense id="n16037.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), āvi, pōtum (in late Lat. potatum, v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to drink out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, and only post-Aug.; in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> class.): <cit><quote lang="la">epotum venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:25" default="NO">25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:453 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 453 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epoto poculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 23, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum expotum,</quote> <trans><tr>wasted in drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to suck up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow up</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus epotis umoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter licet epotum ter vomat illa fretum (Charybdis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epoto Sarmata pastus equo (i. e. sanguine equino),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi terreno Lycus est epotus hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyron (i. e. purpuram Tyriam) epotavere lacernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naumachias videbar epotaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epotus: <entryFree id="n16038" type="main" key="e_po_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēpōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. epoto <sense id="n16038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
epulae: <entryFree id="n16039" type="main" key="e^pu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. epulum.</entryFree>
epularis: <entryFree id="n16040" type="main" key="e^pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>epulum</etym>, <sense id="n16040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a banquet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16040.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epularis accubitio amicorum,</quote> <trans><tr>at a banquet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">1. epulo, II.: sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16040.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: EPULARES appellabantur, qui in quibusdam ludis nocte epulabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 10</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
epulatio: <entryFree id="n16041" type="main" key="e^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>epulor</etym>, <sense id="n16041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating</hi> (very rare), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 204, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">extr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epulator: <entryFree id="n16042" type="main" key="e^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carouser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
epulatorium: <entryFree id="n16043" type="main" key="e^pu^la_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carouse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fragm. Saec. 8, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epulo: <entryFree id="n16044" type="main" key="e^pu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (also EPOLONUS, i, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78, 11</bibl> Müll.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>epulum</etym>, <sense id="n16044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guest at a feast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a feaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carouser.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16044.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 235; Firm. Math. 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16044.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: Tresviri or Septemviri Epulones (in inscrr. also SEPTEMVIR and SEPTEMVIRI [VII. VIR.] EPVLONVM), a t. t. of relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a college of priests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed at first of three and afterwards of seven persons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who superintended the sacrificial banquets</hi> <cb n="EQUE" /> <hi rend="ital">to the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 602</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 590</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">773</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2259</bibl> sq.; Calend. Praenest. Jan. (Orell. Inscr. 2, p. 382).—In <number>sing.</number>: Epulo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 82</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Triumvir Epulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres viri epulones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VII. VIRO. EPVLONI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2365</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16045" type="main" key="E^pu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕpŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 459</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
epulor: <entryFree id="n16046" type="main" key="e^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n16046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [epulum], <hi rend="ital">to hold an entertainment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banquet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16046.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut in voluptate sit, qui epuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 9</bibl>;
