<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to feast upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 537</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:12:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 12, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16046.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast upon</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem epulandum ponere mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 602</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1108</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pullos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
epulum: <entryFree id="n16047" type="main" key="e^pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and in the <number>plur.</number> heterocl. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕpŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (EPULAM antiqui etiam singulariter posuere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 14</bibl> Müll.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. contr. from edipulum, from edo</etym>, <sense id="n16047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sumptuous food</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dishes</hi> (cf.: daps, commissatio, convivium, cena, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16047.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (only in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">si illi congestae sint epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae conquisitissimis epulis exstruebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino et epulis onerati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 18</bibl> Drak.; 23, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 4:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 4, 4 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 572</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 378</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 723</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam exempta fames epulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 829</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 27 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis, blattarum ac tinearum epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 599</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16047.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis epulas dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars animi saturata bonarum cogitationum epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16047.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a sumptuous meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi> (in the <number>sing.</number> usually of banquets held on religious festivals or other public occasions, or which were given to a number of persons; cf. 1. epulo, II.). </sense><sense id="n16047.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis epulum fuit ludorum causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 33, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funebre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 12 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 86</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">(with visceratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. Of a <hi rend="ital">feast</hi> in general, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 229</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16047.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16047.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (carmina) in epulis esse cantitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibusdam neque pecuniae modus est neque honoris, nec epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 45</bibl>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16047.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., less freq. of banquets on religious or public festivals (cf. A.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(with viscerationes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:8:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 8, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
epytus: <entryFree id="n16048" type="main" key="E_py^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēpytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 340</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēpytĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Epytus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and attendant of Iulus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 547</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equa: <entryFree id="n16049" type="main" key="e^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 35</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> equis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 2</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">equabus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 1</bibl></cit> and 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 75, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equarius: <entryFree id="n16050" type="main" key="e^qua_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to horses</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16050.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus,</quote> <trans><tr>a farrier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:15:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16050.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n16050.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stableboy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16050.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. res), <hi rend="ital">a stud of horses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 6.</sense></entryFree>
eques: <entryFree id="n16051" type="main" key="e^que^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a horseman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rider.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16051.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: it eques et plausu cava concutit ungula terram, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 419 ed. Vahlen); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:700" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 700</bibl> (of Castor; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 26</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 27</bibl> (of Bellerophon; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 8</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 38 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <pb n="653" /> <cb n="EQUI" /> of <hi rend="ital">horse and rider</hi>: quadrupes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9</bibl> (who, like the other ancient grammarians, consider eques = equus); cf. Enn. ed. Vahl. p. 37; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 116</bibl> Heyne.— Far more frequently, </sense><sense id="n16051.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16051.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a horse-soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trooper;</hi> opp. pedes, a foot-soldier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15, 3</bibl> (twice); 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 23, 2 et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pedites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; 2, 24, 1; 4, 33, 3 et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. viri or homines, for pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19</bibl>: equites singulares Augusti, v. singularis.—</sense><sense id="n16051.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> or collect., <hi rend="ital">horse-soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavalry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum in Aetolis equitibus praesidii fuit: is longe tum optimus eques in Graecia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 89</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16051.5" n="B" level="2"> Equites, <hi rend="ital">the order of knights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Equites</hi>, who, among the Romans, held a middle rank between the Senate and the Plebs, consisting, under Romulus, of the 300 <hi rend="ital">Celeres</hi>, but whose number, as early as the reign of Tullus Hostilius, had increased to 18 centuries. In the last centuries of the republic this order enjoyed great consideration and influence in the conduct of public affairs, in consequence of the wealth they acquired as farmers of the public taxes, as also by reason of the right to the administration of justice held by them after the year 632 A. U. C. (acc. to the lex Sempronia judiciaria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 29 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 55, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 76</bibl> et saep.; cf. Dict. of Antiq., art. Equites. —</sense><sense id="n16051.6" n="2" level="3"> In the <number>sing.</number> collect., <hi rend="ital">the equestrian order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatores, eques, miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:15 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
equester: <entryFree id="n16052" type="main" key="e^quester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquester</orth>, <itype>tris, tre</itype> (<gen>m.</gen> equestris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:667 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 667 al.</bibl>; v. Zumpt, Gram. § 100, A. 1.; like acris, celebris, celeris, etc.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eques</etym>, <sense id="n16052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a horseman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equestrian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16052.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">equestres statuae inauratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans><tr>riding - horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16052.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16052.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to cavalry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 2</bibl> et saep. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae (opp. pedestres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit> et saep. So as an epithet of Fortuna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16052.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the order of knights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equestrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equestri loco natus, ortus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestri genere natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 383</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus (i. e. aureus, a privilege of the equestrian order),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 8, § 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 19 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n16052.5" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n16052.6" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">equester</orth> = eques, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud equestres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16052.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">equestria</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">the seats of the knights in the theatre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equidem: <entryFree id="n16053" type="main" key="e^qui^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>comp. of the <pos>interj.</pos> ĕ and quidem enclit.; cf. edepol</etym>, a demonstrative corroborative particle, <sense id="n16053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">verily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at all events</hi>, = certe, revera, etc. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16053.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n16053.2" n="A" level="2"> Without other particles. </sense><sense id="n16053.3" n="1" level="3"> With 1. <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi> in affirming a fact concerning one's self, or confirming a previous remark; <cit><quote lang="la">equidem Sosia Amphitruonis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>: i in malam rem. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Ibi sum equidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inquit, equidem novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem et ante hoc tempus te dilexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem etiam illud mihi animum advertisse videor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id equidem ego certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 576</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 10, 6</bibl> Kritz.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16053.4" n="2" level="3"> With the 1. <hi rend="ital">pers. plur.</hi>: <cb n="EQUI" /> equidem, ere, nos jam dudum hic te apsentem incusamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 11</bibl> (but not in Cicero, Horace, Vergil, or Quintilian; v. R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Lat. Part. p. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 37</bibl>; Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n16053.5" n="3" level="3"> With the 2. and 3. <hi rend="ital">perss. sing.</hi> (perh. not in Plaut.; v. Ritschl, prol. ad Trin. p. 76 sq.; corrected, quidem, Stich. 2, 2, 5; 4, 1, 48; Mil. 3, 1, 55 Fleck.; <cit><quote lang="la">Men. 2, 2, 35 Brix, etc. But quando equidem nec tibi bene esse pote pati, etc., Trin. 2, 2, 71 Ritschl<hi rend="sup">2</hi>: atque equidem ipsus ultro venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit> Ritschl<hi rend="sup">2</hi>; cf. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 41</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">scitis equidem milites, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanum equidem hoc consilium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16053.6" n="4" level="3"> With 3. <hi rend="ital">pers. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem innumerabiles mihi videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me equidem sint omnia alba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:110" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem si nobis religiones nullae essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentem equidem dicebant emisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16053.7" n="B" level="2"> Sometimes made more emphatic by certe, edepol, ecastor, hercle, etc. (most freq. in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">certe equidem noster sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem certo idem sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo edepol equidem dormire solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem pol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe equidem edepol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. with 3. <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem edepol liberali'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem ecastor vigilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16053.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16053.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, in a concessive sense. <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Sine. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Sino equidem, si lubet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 18</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">Q.</hi> Sed perge cetera. <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Pergam equidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 69</bibl>.— So with <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi equidem, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego nolim equidem apud rusticos, sed multo minus apud vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus epistolis sum equidem abs te lacessitus ad scribendum, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with foll. verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit> (with ego); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with verumtamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with sed tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:79 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 79 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with ceterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16053.10" n="B" level="2"> Sometimes with pregn. reference to the speaker, <hi rend="ital">for my part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as I am concerned</hi>: equidem me Caesaris militem dici volui; <cit><quote lang="la">vos me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem doleo non me tuis litteris certiorem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod equidem sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 98, 101, § 220</bibl>.—Cf. Hand Turs. II. pp. 422-437.</sense></entryFree>
equiferus: <entryFree id="n16054" type="main" key="e^qui^fe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭ-fĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:197" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 13, 55, § 197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equile: <entryFree id="n16055" type="main" key="e^qui_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.; cf.: bubile, caprile, ovile, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n16055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stable for horses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equimentum: <entryFree id="n16056" type="hapax" key="e^qui_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fee for covering</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 69, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equimulga: <entryFree id="n16057" type="hapax" key="e^qui^mulga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭ-mulga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> [equus-mulgeo), <sense id="n16057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mare-milker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 43</bibl> (al. equimulgos).</sense></entryFree>
equinus: <entryFree id="n16058" type="main" key="e^qui_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to horses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:38:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl></cit>: seta, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptio (i. e. equorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 23, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
equio: <entryFree id="n16059" type="main" key="e^qui^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, of mares, <sense id="n16059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in heat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 181</bibl>; perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equiria: <entryFree id="n16060" type="main" key="e^qui_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquīrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the annual horse-races</hi>, <hi rend="ital">held on the</hi> 27<hi rend="ital">th of February and the</hi> 14<hi rend="ital">th of March in the</hi> Campus Martius, <hi rend="ital">in honor of Mars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:859" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 859</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 519</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 12</bibl>, and 131, 13 Müll., s. v. MARTIALIS CAMPVS, p. 96.</sense></entryFree>
equirine: <entryFree id="n16061" type="gloss" key="equi^ri_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">equĭrīne</orth>, <itype>jusjurandum per Quirinum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 13</bibl> Müll.; cf.: ecastor, ejuno.</entryFree>
equisaetum: <entryFree id="n16062" type="main" key="e^qui^saetum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭsaetum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>equus-seta</etym>, <sense id="n16062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the</hi> <cb n="EQUU" /> <hi rend="ital">plant horse-tail</hi>, equisetum arvense, Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 83, § 132</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭsae-tis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭ-sēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 40</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
equiso: <entryFree id="n16063" type="main" key="e^qui_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquīso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a groom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stableboy</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194</bibl>: equisones nautici, <hi rend="ital">who draw vessels along by ropes</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 451, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equitabilis: <entryFree id="n16064" type="main" key="e^qui^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>equito</etym>, <sense id="n16064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be ridden over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
equitatio: <entryFree id="n16065" type="hapax" key="e^qui^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a riding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equitatus: <entryFree id="n16066" type="main" key="e^qui^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n16066.0" n="I" level="1"> In abstr., = equitatio, <hi rend="ital">a riding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atteri equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16066.1" n="II" level="1"> In concr. </sense><sense id="n16066.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cavalry</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 24, 1 et saep.: ferreus,</quote> <trans><tr>harnessed cavalry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> equitatu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 52</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">equitatui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 5</bibl></cit>; 7, 4, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 89, 3</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16066.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The equestrian order</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 9, § 35</bibl>; cf. ib. § 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16067" type="hapax" key="e^qui^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>equio</etym>, <sense id="n16067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being in heat</hi>, of mares (with hinnitus), Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
equitiarius: <entryFree id="n16068" type="hapax" key="e^qui^ti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>equitium</etym>, <sense id="n16068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inspector of a stud</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 13.</sense></entryFree>
equitium: <entryFree id="n16069" type="main" key="e^qui^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stud of horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:12:section=4 al" default="NO">7, 8, 12, § 4 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equito: <entryFree id="n16070" type="main" key="e^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [eques], <hi rend="ital">to ride.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16070.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16070.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum in illo nostro exercitu equitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in equuleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; v. Equuleus, II. A.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in arundine longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16070.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to eques, II. A.): EQVITARE antiqui dicebant equum publicum merere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:81:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 81, 15</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n16070.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16070.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To skirmish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manœuvre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (certatio) qua tu contra Alfenum equitabas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 22, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16070.6" n="2" level="3"> Of the horse, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 10</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 107, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16070.7" n="3" level="3"> Of the wind, like <foreign lang="greek">i(ppeu/ein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to blow violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus per undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: per caelum, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> Fr. 14, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16070.8" n="4" level="3"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:311" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 311</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16070.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride through</hi> (post-Aug.).—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen equitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitataque Culmina Taÿgeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Bell. Get. 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxis equitata Bactra Parthis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
equula: <entryFree id="n16071" type="main" key="e^quu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>equa</etym>. <sense id="n16071.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little mare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a filly</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16071.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a voluptuous woman, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 617</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
equuleus: <entryFree id="n16072" type="main" key="e^quu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquŭlĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕcŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>equus</etym>, <sense id="n16072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16072.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr., Pompon., and Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16072.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16072.3" n="A" level="2"> Eculeos argenteos nobilis aufert, <hi rend="ital">horses wrought in silver</hi>, works of art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 42</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the sarcastic pun: jactabit se et in his equitabit equuleis,</quote> <trans><tr>Emi</tr>, <tr>pecuniam solvi</tr>, <tr>on these hobbies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 43.—</sense><sense id="n16072.4" n="B" level="2"> As an instrument of torture, <hi rend="ital">a wooden rack</hi> in the shape of a horse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. Poët. Tusc. 3, 28, 67; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 109 al.</sense></entryFree>
equulus: <entryFree id="n16073" type="main" key="e^quu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small young horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:8" default="NO">2, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:14:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 14, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
equus: <entryFree id="n16074" type="main" key="e^quus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n16074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> equūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:409 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 409 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. acvas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">i)/kkos</foreign>); cf. Epŏna; root, ak-, to be sharp or swift; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/kros, w)ku/s</foreign>; Lat. acus, ocior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charger.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16074.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n16074.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caballus, canterius, mannus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 5, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 441 ed. Vahlen); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">equus = equa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—Offered as a sacrifice to Mars, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 16</bibl>, and p. 178, 24 sq. Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 20; and v. October: EQVO PVBLICO ORNATVS, EXORNATVS, HONORATVS, etc.; or, ellipt., EQVO PVBLICO, very often <pb n="654" /> <cb n="ERAD" /> in inscriptions; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Momms.</author> 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">459</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">445</bibl>; 1952; 2456; <cit><quote lang="la">2865 al.—In another sense: equi publici,</quote> <trans><tr>post-horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—Equo vehi, advehi, ire, desilire, equum conscendere, flectere, in equum ascendere, equo citato, concitato, etc., see under these verbs.—</sense><sense id="n16074.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16074.4" n="1" level="3"> Of cavalry, in the phrase, equis virisque (viri = pedites; cf. eques and vir), adverb., <hi rend="ital">with horse and foot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with might and main</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with tooth and nail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: equis, viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hamilc. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hamilc. 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the order, viris equisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of race-horses: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cursu corrigam tarditatem tum equis, tum vero, quoniam scribis poëma ab eo nostrum probari, quadrigis poeticis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in prose and poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, a (see the passage in connection).—</sense><sense id="n16074.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16074.7" n="1" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number> (like <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppoi</foreign> in Homer), <hi rend="ital">a chariot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 777</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.8" n="2" level="3"> The wind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:611" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 611</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.9" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.10" n="D" level="2"> Prov.: equi donati dentes non inspiciuntur, <hi rend="ital">we don't look a gift horse in the mouth</hi>, Hier. Ep. ad Ephes. prooem.— </sense><sense id="n16074.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16074.12" n="A" level="2"> Equus bipes, <hi rend="ital">a sea-horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 389</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Pervig. Ven. 10: fluviatilis,</quote> <trans><tr>a river-horse</tr>, <tr>hippopotamus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.13" n="B" level="2"> Equus ligneus, like the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a(lo\s i(/ppos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Trojan horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:112 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 112 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 108" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 13 al.</bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n16074.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a secret conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.16" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A battering-ram</hi>, because shaped like a horse; <cit><quote lang="la">afterwards called aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.17" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation Pegasus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:17" default="NO">3, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16074.18" n="F" level="1"> Equus Trojanus, <hi rend="ital">the title of a play of Livius Andronicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
equustuticus: <entryFree id="n16075" type="main" key="Equus Tu_ti^cus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Equus Tūtĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Eleuterio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. the interpreters of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 87</bibl>; and Mommsen in Bullett. d. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1847, p. 170</bibl>, and 1848, p. 7 sq.</sense></entryFree>
er: <entryFree id="n16076" type="main" key="e_r1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēr</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ēris</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xh/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n16076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedgehog</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16077" type="main" key="Er2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Er</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Her</orth>), <itype>Eris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pamphylian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to legend</hi> (cited in Plato Polit. 10, 12, p. 626), <hi rend="ital">rose from the dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
era: <entryFree id="n16078" type="main" key="e^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕra</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hera</orth>; v. erus), ae (archaic <sense id="n16078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> ĕrāï, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7, 5</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n16078.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the mistress of a house</hi>, with respect to the servants; <hi rend="ital">the mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lady</hi>: nunquam era errans (i. e. Medea), etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 287 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">servus Dat (puellam) erae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 44 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 3</bibl>; 2, 8, 70; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 8</bibl>. So, era major and era minor, <hi rend="ital">the old and young mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lady of the house and her daughter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 22</bibl> and 23.—</sense><sense id="n16078.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">female ruler</hi> or <hi rend="ital">governor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16078.3" n="A" level="2"> Of goddesses: domina, era (Minerva), Enn. ap. Ach. <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> ad Cat. 1, 9</bibl> (Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 177</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 22): <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna, era,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit> dub.; cf.: vosne velit an me regnare era quidve ferat Fors, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 203 Vahl.—for which, sit sane Fors domina campi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">rapidi Tritonis era,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarate erae (i. e. Cybeles) citatis erroribus animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergeminam tunc placat eram (Hecaten),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:780" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis eram Ditemque ciens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Proserpine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:313" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 313</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16078.4" n="B" level="2"> Of sweethearts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 136</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eradicatio: <entryFree id="n16079" type="main" key="e_ra_di_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērādīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eradico</etym>, <sense id="n16079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rooting out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 37, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eradicationem posuisti me,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an example of utter destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thren. 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eradicitus: <entryFree id="n16080" type="main" key="e_ra_di_ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rādīcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exradicitus.</entryFree>
eradico: <entryFree id="n16081" type="main" key="e_ra_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rādīco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n16081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> eradicarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 21</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck up by the roots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to root out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eradicate</hi> (an ante-class. word). </sense><sense id="n16081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex terra enata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16081.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to root out</tr>, <tr>utterly destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 18, 7</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n16081.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: pugnis memorandis suis hominum<cb n="EREC" />  aures, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pester</hi> with talking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erado: <entryFree id="n16082" type="main" key="e_ra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrape off</hi> (ante-class. and since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n16082.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eradere atque eruere terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">muscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (albo),</quote> <trans><tr>to strike out</tr>, <tr>erase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inscriptos titulos monumento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: genas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to shave off the beard</hi> (for which, shortly before, vellere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 26.— </sense><sense id="n16082.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extirpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eradicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: curam habendi penitus corde, Phacdr. 3, prol. 21; so, elementa cupidinis pravi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia quoque nobilium civitatum (tempus),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to obliterate</tr>, <tr>cause to be forgotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum de terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 28, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erana: <entryFree id="n16083" type="main" key="E^ra^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrăna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Amanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eranthemis: <entryFree id="n16084" type="greek" key="e_ranthe^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēranthĕmis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)ranqemi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the plant</hi> anthemis, <hi rend="ital">the chamomile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eranus: <entryFree id="n16085" type="greek" key="e^ra^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ravos</foreign>, <sense id="n16085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fund contributed for mutual protection against want</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessum est eranum habere ... si tali conlatione non ad turbas et ad inlicitos coetus, sed ad sustinendam tenuiorum inopiam utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erasinus: <entryFree id="n16086" type="main" key="E^ra^si_nus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrăsīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erasi=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n16086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Argolis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kephalari</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 276</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 3:26:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 3, 26, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n16086.1" n="2" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrăsīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erasi=vos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite boy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
erasistratus: <entryFree id="n16087" type="main" key="E^ra^sistra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrăsistrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erasi/stratos</foreign>, <sense id="n16087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous physician of Alexandria in the time of Ptolemy Lagus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of a medical school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7</bibl> ext. 1; Cels. praef. 3, 4; 4, 4 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
erastes: <entryFree id="n16088" type="greek" key="e^rastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erasus: <entryFree id="n16089" type="main" key="e_ra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from erado.</entryFree>
eratine: <entryFree id="n16090" type="greek" key="E^ra^ti_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrătīnē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erateivh/</foreign>, <sense id="n16090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Venus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 905</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erato: <entryFree id="n16091" type="main" key="E^ra^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrătō</orth> (occurring only in the <case>nom.</case>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eratw/</foreign>. <sense id="n16091.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The muse of lyric and amorous poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:195" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">425</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16091.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a Muse</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 37</bibl> Serv.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mall. Theod. 282</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16091.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A queen of Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
