eratosthenes: <entryFree id="n16092" type="main" key="E^ra^tosthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrătosthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eratosqe/vhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated geographer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and philosopher of Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under Ptolemy Euergetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Elench. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Elench. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:108:112" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 108, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:14 al" default="NO">11, 2, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ercisco: <entryFree id="n16093" type="main" key="ercisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ercisco</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">erctum</orth>, v. hercisco.</entryFree>
erebus: <entryFree id="n16094" type="main" key="E^re^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/erebos</foreign>. <sense id="n16094.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The god of darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Chaos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Nox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Hyg. Myth. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 510</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 404</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16094.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 471</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 543</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 76</bibl>, al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16094.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕbēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of or belonging to the Lower World</hi>: colubrae, Ov. lb. 229.</sense></entryFree>
erechtheus: <entryFree id="n16095" type="main" key="E^rechtheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrechtheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erexqeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabled king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Procris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orithyia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Chthonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Creüsa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who devoted themselves to death for their country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:667 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 667 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 697</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16095.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n16095.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrechthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Erechthean</hi>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:204" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 548</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n16095.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrecthī-dae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Athenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16095.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrechthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Erechtheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orithyia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Procris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 726</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erecte: <entryFree id="n16096" type="main" key="e_recte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērecte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, v. erigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
erectio: <entryFree id="n16097" type="main" key="e_recti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erigo</etym>, <sense id="n16097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8</bibl> praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 10, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16097.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 22, 20</bibl>. <cb n="ERGA" /></sense></entryFree>
erectus: <entryFree id="n16098" type="main" key="e_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from erigo.</entryFree>

Orb. 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 170 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eremigo: <entryFree id="n16100" type="main" key="e_re_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rēmĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to row</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sail through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to navigate</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:190" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septentrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Sever. Dial. 17.</sense></entryFree>
eremitis: <entryFree id="n16102" type="greek" key="e^re_mi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrēmītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n16102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rhmiti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recluse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eremodicium: <entryFree id="n16103" type="greek" key="e^re_mo^di^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrēmŏdĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rhmodiki/ov</foreign>, <sense id="n16103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a default of appearance before a court at the appointed time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:7:13" default="NO">46, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 1, 13, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Matyr. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eremus: <entryFree id="n16104" type="greek" key="e^re_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrēmus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĕmus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cathem. 5, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 371</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/rhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n16104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n16104.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 57, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16104.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. locus), or <gen>f.</gen> (sc. regio), <hi rend="ital">a wilderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 5</bibl>; Sulpic. Sever. Dial. 1, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:1:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 1, 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
erepo: <entryFree id="n16105" type="main" key="e_re_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rēpo</orth>, <itype>psi, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj. sync.</hi> erepsemus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 79</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (anteclass. and since the Aug. period.). </sense><sense id="n16105.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16105.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:617" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 617</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:581" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 581</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16105.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in an upward direction, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamber up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. of a building, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16105.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia quoque circa paupertatem plurimum morae habet, dum ex illa erepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16105.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16105.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To creep through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum agrum genibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:526" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 526</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16105.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To climb</hi>: montes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erepticius: <entryFree id="n16106" type="main" key="e_repti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēreptīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eripio</etym>, <sense id="n16106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is taken away from one for punishment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ereptio: <entryFree id="n16107" type="main" key="e_repti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēreptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forcible taking away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seizure</hi> of a possession, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ereptor: <entryFree id="n16108" type="main" key="e_reptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēreptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ereptus: <entryFree id="n16109" type="main" key="e_reptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēreptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eripio.</entryFree>
eres: <entryFree id="n16110" type="main" key="e_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēres</orth>, v. heres.</entryFree>
eretria: <entryFree id="n16111" type="main" key="E^re^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eretri/a</foreign>. <sense id="n16111.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The principal city on the island of Euboea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the philosopher Menedemus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Palaeo Castro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 38 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16111.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv., </sense><sense id="n16111.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Eretrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 163</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eretria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 21, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16111.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭ-ensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Eretria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gongylus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrienses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Eretria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16111.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">philosophers of the school of Menedemus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 109</bibl>. —Also called, </sense><sense id="n16111.5" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭci</orth>, ōrum., <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĕtrĭcus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an Eretrian philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16111.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Phthiotis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tzangli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eretum: <entryFree id="n16112" type="main" key="E_re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/hrhtov</foreign>, <sense id="n16112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grotta Marozza</hi> (acc. to G. Long, <hi rend="ital">Rimane</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērētīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Eretum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erga: <entryFree id="n16113" type="main" key="erga_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergā</orth>, <sense id="n16113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep.</hi> [syncop. for e-regā, from ex and root rag-, to reach upward, be upright; cf. ergo, v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 448 sqq.], <hi rend="ital">over against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite to</hi> (cf.: adversus, versus, contra, e regione, e contrario). </sense><sense id="n16113.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of locality (ante- and post-classical and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quae med erga aedes habet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>opposite me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit> (al. modo erga): <cit><quote lang="la">erga regiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16113.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquem, more rarely aliquid, of feelings and conduct <hi rend="ital">towards</hi> a person. </sense><sense id="n16113.3" n="A" level="2"> Of friendly feelings, etc. (so mostly in class. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">erga et in hoc differunt: fere enim erga ad affectum refertur, quasi erga illum benignus: in ad simultatem, quasi in illum sum saevus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 208</bibl></cit> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 989</bibl>: ut eodem modo erga amicum affecti simus, <pb n="655" /> <cb n="ERGO" /> quo erga nosmet ipsos ... ut nostra in amicos benevolentia illorum erga nos benevolentiae pariter respondeat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga aliquem benevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 49, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 111</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina bonitas erga homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetua erga populum Romanum fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 84, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">te oro per mei te erga bonitatem patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">te erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">med erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the following.—Relating to things: cum in universam rem publicam, tum etiam erga meam salutem fide ac benevolentia singulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16113.4" n="B" level="2"> Of unfriendly feelings, for the usual contra or adversus, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne malus item erga me sit, ut illum erga fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium, quod erga regem susceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transp.: med erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 9</bibl>.—Relating to things: <cit><quote lang="la">res secundae valent commutare naturam, et raro quisquam erga bona sua satis cautus est,</quote> <trans><tr>against his own advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:40" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16113.5" n="III" level="1"> In post-Aug. authors (esp. in Tacitus) in gen. of every kind of mental relation to a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in respect to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxii erga Sejanum, cujus durior congressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga Germanicos exercitus laudes gratesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prisco erga duces honore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 74</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema erga memoriam filii sui munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrociore semper fama erga dominantium exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10</bibl>; v. Hand Turs. II. pp. 437-440.</sense></entryFree>
ergasterium: <entryFree id="n16114" type="greek" key="ergaste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rgasth/riov</foreign>, <sense id="n16114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a workshop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 41, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ergasticus: <entryFree id="n16115" type="greek" key="ergasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rgastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be done</hi>: schemata; as geom. t. t., <hi rend="ital">problems</hi> (opp. apodictica, <hi rend="ital">theorems</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 715</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ergastularis: <entryFree id="n16116" type="main" key="ergastu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16116.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr></sense></entryFree>
ergastularius: <entryFree id="n16117" type="main" key="ergastu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ergastulum</etym>, <sense id="n16117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a workhouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">house of correction</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n16117.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Also: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenebris ergastularibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16117.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastularii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. servi), <hi rend="ital">overseers of a penitentiary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ergastulum: <entryFree id="n16118" type="main" key="ergastu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)rga/zomai</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n16118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a workhouse</hi> for offenders (slaves, debtors, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a house of correction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penitentiary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16118.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:16" default="NO">1, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 8 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:6:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 6, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16118.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastula</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (like stabula, servitia, mancipia, etc.), <hi rend="ital">the inmates of a workhouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penitentiary convicts</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22, 2</bibl>; Brutus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:24 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 24 al.</bibl>—In the <hi rend="ital">masc. sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ergastŭlus</orth>=ergastularius, <hi rend="ital">a foreman in a workhouse</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 447, 7 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ergata: <entryFree id="n16119" type="greek" key="erga^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rga/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n16119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of capstan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">windlass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ergetum: <entryFree id="n16120" type="main" key="Erge_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ergētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Citadella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:250" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 250</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ergētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ergo: <entryFree id="n16121" type="main" key="ergo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergō</orth> (rarely with short <sense id="n16121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> in Ov. and the post-Aug. poets, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 59</bibl> Lennep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:407" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 407</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 4, 17</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for e-regō, from ex and root rag-, to extend upward; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)re/gw</foreign>, L. rego, Germ. ragen; v. erga, and Corss. Ausspr. 1, 448 sqq.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">proceeding from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16121.1" n="I" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (placed after it, like causa and gratia), <hi rend="ital">in consequence of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because of</hi> (ante-class, but not in Plaut. or Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">quojus rei ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:141:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus rei ergo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 3; 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 139</bibl>; Tab. Publica ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: dono militari virtutis ergo donari, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7</bibl>; so, virtutis ergo, Lex <cb n="ERGO" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 107, 16</bibl>: ejus victoriae ergo, Inscr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 3</bibl>: funeris ergo, Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus legis ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidinis ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 670</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16121.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (for cujus rei ergo), <hi rend="ital">consequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi> (class.): unus homo nobis cunctando restituit rem: ergo postque magisque viri nunc gloria claret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polemoni et jam ante Aristoteli ea prima visa sunt, quae paulo ante dixi. Ergo nata est sententia veterum Academicorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albano non plus animi erat quam fidei, nec manere ergo, nec transire aperte ausus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 58</bibl> et saep.—The reason or cause sometimes follows with quia, quod: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo istoc magis, quia vaniloquus, vapulabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 222</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 18</bibl>.—Ante- and postclass. pleonast.: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo igitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur ergo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104 al.</bibl></cit> —So in Ter. and Liv.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl> Drak.; 3, 31, 5 Gron.; 9, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 39, 25.—</sense><sense id="n16121.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16121.4" n="1" level="3"> In a logical conclusion, <hi rend="ital">consequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat haec filiam me suam esse: non ergo haec mater mea est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:49" default="NO">49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">59 sq. al.: nullum dicere causae esse genus amentia est, etc. ... Relinquitur ergo, ut omnia tria genera sint causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est enim, in quo sit cupiditas, quin recte cupidus dici possit? Ergo et avarus erit, sed finite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam esset ferreus qui eam vitam ferre posset, etc.? Verum ergo illud est, quod a Tarentino Archyta dici solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 88</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">corresponding to igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; so consecutively, igitur ... ergo ... ergo ... igitur ... <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:56 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 56 sq.</bibl>—So with si, cum, quia, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ego nisi peperissem, Roma non oppugnaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 25</bibl>. —So esp. in Cicero, like <hi rend="ital">an</hi> (v. an I. D.), in interrogative argumentation, a minore ad majus, or ex aequo, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo haec veteranus miles facere poterit, doctus vir sapiensque non poterit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl></cit>; so with the <hi rend="ital">future</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 41; 1, 14, 31; 3, 15, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo illi intelligunt, quid Epicurus dicat, ego non intelligo?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo Ennio licuit vetera contemnenti dicere, etc. ... mihi de antiquis eodem modo non licebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16121.5" n="2" level="3"> In interrogations. </sense><sense id="n16121.6" n="a" level="4"> When an explanation is asked, <hi rend="ital">do you say? do you mean? then: S.</hi> Quo agis? <hi rend="ital">P.</hi> Quo tu? ... <hi rend="ital">S.</hi> Quo ergo, scelus? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 23</bibl>: Ipsus es? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Ipsus Charmides sum. <hi rend="ital">S.</hi> Ergo ipsusne es? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16121.7" n="b" level="4"> When a consequence is inquired for, Engl. <hi rend="ital">then: Ps.</hi> lstuc ego jam satis scio. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Cur ergo, quod scis, me rogas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo in iis adolescentibus bonam spem esse dicemus, quos? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedemus ergo Hannibalem? dicet aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">num ergo is excaecat nos aut orbat sensibus, si? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">num ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stamus? quin ergo imus?</quote> <trans><tr>why not then?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quin ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 93</bibl>.— Esp. freq., quid ergo? like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti/ ou)=v</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">why then? but why?</hi> quid ergo hanc dubitas colloqui? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo? hujusne vitae propositio Thyesten levare poterit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77, 10</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n16121.8" n="3" level="3"> With imperatives and words used imperatively, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato ergo istum symbolum illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ergo, hanc conclusionem probaturusne sis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinite ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amplectere ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cb n="ERIG" /> ausculta ergo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 18</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu ergo i modo,</quote> <trans><tr>come now</tr>, <tr>begone!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu ergo omitte genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum ergo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—So with the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">age eamus ergo, intro ergo abeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeamus ergo intro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo des minam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43</bibl>.—And with the <hi rend="ital">future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo, si sapis, mussitabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16121.9" n="4" level="3"> Like igitur, in resuming an interrupted train of thought, <hi rend="ital">as I was saying; I say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then; well then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres viae sunt ad Mutinam, quo festinat animus, ut, etc. ... Tres ergo ut dixi viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 13, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:19:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 19, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.—So (like igitur and inquam) after parenthetical sentences, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 10, 1</bibl>.—Less freq. for inquam in a mere repetition: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi tuus pater, Pater hujus ergo, hospes Antidamas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; or in beginning a subject with reference to the expectation of the auditors (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/ra</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipite ergo animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 29</bibl>. See Hand Turs. II. pp. 440-467.</sense></entryFree>
ergolabus: <entryFree id="n16122" type="greek" key="ergo^la^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ergŏlăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rgola/bos</foreign>, <sense id="n16122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contractor</hi> for work (pure Lat. redemptor), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 59, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erice: <entryFree id="n16123" type="greek" key="e^ri_ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrīce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rei/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n16123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 39, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 16, 15, § 41</bibl> sq. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrīcaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the heath-flower</hi>, i. e. collected from it: <cit><quote lang="la">mel (= mel sylvestre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erichtho: <entryFree id="n16124" type="main" key="E^richtho_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrichthō</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erixqw/</foreign>, <sense id="n16124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thessalian witch consulted by Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 508</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence transf., of another witch,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erichthonius: <entryFree id="n16125" type="main" key="E^richtho^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrichthŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erixqo/vios</foreign>. <sense id="n16125.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the first who yoked four horses together to a chariot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 113</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 553</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 424</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 166" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 166</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16125.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrichthŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Athenian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 30</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n16125.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Dardanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Tros and king of Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 130</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16125.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrichthŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 333</bibl></cit> Forbig.; 342.</sense></entryFree>
ericinium: <entryFree id="n16126" type="main" key="Ericinium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ericinium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Perrhaebia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ericinus: <entryFree id="n16127" type="main" key="e_ri^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ericius</etym>, <sense id="n16127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the hedgehog</hi>: caro, August. cont. Faust. 30, 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ericius: <entryFree id="n16128" type="main" key="e_ri^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>er</etym>, <sense id="n16128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedgehog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urchin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16128.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 10</bibl>, and 106, 18; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 11</bibl> (as translation of Heb. <hi rend="ital">kipōd</hi>, which was probably a bird—perh. <hi rend="ital">the bittern.</hi> But the LXX. and Gesenius, Thes. Heb. s. v., sustain the Vulgate).—</sense><sense id="n16128.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a beam armed with sharp spikes to keep off assailants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 67, 5</bibl> and 6; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eridanus: <entryFree id="n16129" type="main" key="E_ri^da^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērĭdănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hridano/s</foreign>. <sense id="n16129.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mythical and poetical name of the river Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20</bibl>, § § 117, 120; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 659</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl> (5), 10, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">372</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 640</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16129.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Eridanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=389" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:32" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 838 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
erifuga: <entryFree id="n16130" type="main" key="e^ri^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭ-fŭga</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">heri-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (erus-fugio), <sense id="n16130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runaway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slave who absconds from his master</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erifugae Famuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erigeron: <entryFree id="n16131" type="greek" key="e_ri^ge^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērĭgĕron</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)rige/rwv</foreign>, <sense id="n16131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant groundsel</hi>, Senecio vulg., Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:167 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 167 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:133" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 64, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erigo: <entryFree id="n16132" type="main" key="e_ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rĭgo</orth>, <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n16132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to erect</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16132.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrum jubar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ar borem (with extollere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <trans><tr>to form erect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 85</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ad tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen in adversum clivum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lead up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem in collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to raise</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16132.3" n="b" level="4"> With se, <pb n="656" /> <cb n="ERIG" /> or (more freq., esp. since the Aug. per.) mid., <hi rend="ital">to set one's self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">connituntur (pueri), ut sese erigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sese aut sublevare (Alces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura breves in digitos eriguntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>raise themselves on tiptoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armos (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:502" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 512</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sidera (fumus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 214</bibl></cit> et saep.— Said of <hi rend="ital">rising</hi> ground, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n16132.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16132.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxeas turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis totidem erexit villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16132.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, because of the erect posture assumed: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanus erigit totam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16132.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16132.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigite mentes auresque vestras et me attendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aures (with animum attendere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res relata exspectatione certaminis senatum erexisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had aroused</tr>, <tr>excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. under <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi> B. 2.: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeos severitatis in rem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas malis oppressa civilibus extollere jam caput et aliquando se erigere debebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum se erexit et addidit historiae majorem sonum vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n16132.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheer up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigebat animum jam demissum et oppressum Oppianicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam tu provinciam afflictam et perditam erexisti atque recreasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: rempublicam, Pompeius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam ex tam gravi casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos populos ad cupidinem novae fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos ad spem belli, Caesarem ad coercendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lusitanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciam Pori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ad spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubito quin tuis litteris se magis etiam erexerit ab omnique sollicitudine abstraxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad spem libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad imitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—Mid., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:14" default="NO">23, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ērectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">set up; upright; elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16132.10" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum eos (homines) humo excitatos celsos et erectos constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erectus et celsus status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 86</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viriditas culmo geniculato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">petra in metae modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 6, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Jul. Valer. Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 31.—</sense><sense id="n16132.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16132.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsus et erectus et ea quae homini accidere possunt omnia parva ducens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animus (with magnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectior homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet mens nostra natura sublime quiddam et erectum et impatiens superioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16132.13" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16132.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Intent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the stretch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 54, 200</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensique (Horatii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs, civitas exspectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos ad libertatem recuperandam (with ardentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens circa studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in legendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erecta in Othonem studia,</quote> <trans><tr>lively sympathies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad agendum erectiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16132.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Animated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones nostrae in eum saepe locum profectae alacri animo et erecto, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vero multo sum erectior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectis animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ērectē</orth> (acc. to B. 3.), <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageously</hi> (late Lat.); in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erigone: <entryFree id="n16133" type="main" key="E_ri^go^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērĭgŏne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hrigo/vh</foreign>. <sense id="n16133.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Icarius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who hung herself through grief for her father's death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was rewarded for it by being translated to the sky as the constellation</hi> Virgo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 130" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:254" default="NO">254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 33</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6</bibl>, <cb n="ERIP" /> 125.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērĭgŏnēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Maera</tr>, <tr>the hound of Icarius</tr>, <tr>who was placed along with her in the sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:723" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 723</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Canis Erigones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:400" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 400</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Aegisthus and Clytemnestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 122" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16133.2" n="III" level="1"> Astraea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erigonus: <entryFree id="n16134" type="main" key="E^ri^go_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĭgōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erigw/v</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)eri/gwv</foreign>, <sense id="n16134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tzerna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 53</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
erilis: <entryFree id="n16135" type="main" key="e^ri_^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrī^lis</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrīlis</orth>, v. erus), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>erus</etym>, <sense id="n16135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mistress of a family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the master's</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mistress's</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in Plaut.): erum fefelli, in nuptias conjeci erilem filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 58</bibl>;
