<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concubina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">68: erilis patria, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressumque canes comitantur erilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensaeque assuetus erili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: antiqua erilis fida custos corporis (i. e. Medeae), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 289 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi erile mavis Carpere pensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crilis praevortit metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen erile tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpi clausus in arca, Quo te demisit peccati conscia (ancilla) erilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erillus: <entryFree id="n16136" type="main" key="E_rillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hērillus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Stoic philosopher of Carthage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished about</hi> B. C. 260, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl>.,—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērillĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Her-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the disciples of Erillus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erinaceus: <entryFree id="n16137" type="main" key="e_ri^na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērĭnācĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">herin-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>er; cf. ericius</etym>, <sense id="n16137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedgehog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 63, 83, § 174 al.</bibl> (Sillig; dub.—Jan. irenaceus).</sense></entryFree>
erindes: <entryFree id="n16138" type="main" key="Erindes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Erindes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river between Media and Hyrcanea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erineos: <entryFree id="n16139" type="greek" key="e^ri_ne^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrīnĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)riveo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. the Campanula Rapunculus, Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 65, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erinna: <entryFree id="n16140" type="main" key="E_rinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ērinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/hrivva</foreign>, <sense id="n16140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Lesbian poetess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Sappho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Erinnēs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erinys: <entryFree id="n16141" type="main" key="E^ri_nys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrīnys</orth> (or, less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Erinnys</orth>; cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 337</bibl>), <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erinnu/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*)erinu/s</foreign>), <sense id="n16141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 447</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 14</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Erinyn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 725</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinyes,</quote> <trans><tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 13, 29 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 103</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Erinyas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:345" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 345</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16141.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16141.2" n="A" level="2"> Of Helen: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae patriae communis Erinys,</quote> <trans><tr>the scourge</tr>, <tr>curse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 573</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16141.3" n="B" level="2"> Appellatively, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi> = furor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 337</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 187</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eriophoros: <entryFree id="n16142" type="greek" key="e^ri^o^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭŏphŏros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)riofo/ros</foreign> (woolbearer), <sense id="n16142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 10, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erioxylon: <entryFree id="n16143" type="greek" key="e^ri^oxy^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭoxylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rio/culov</foreign>, <sense id="n16143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cotton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eriphia: <entryFree id="n16144" type="greek" key="e^ri^phi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭphīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rifei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n16144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 103, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eriphyla: <entryFree id="n16145" type="main" key="E^ri^phy_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĭphȳla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)erifu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n16145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Talaüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Amphiaraüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom she betrayed to Polynices for a golden necklace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for which she was slain by her son Alcmaeon.</hi>—Form -a, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:50:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 50, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16, 29</bibl> (3, 8, 29 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">3, 13, 57 (4, 12, 57 M.).— Form -e,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 445</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae Eriphylae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:655" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 655</bibl></cit>, v. Amphiaraus.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16145.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĭphȳlaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Eriphyla</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:211" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eripio: <entryFree id="n16146" type="main" key="e_ri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭpŭi, eptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n16146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pull out; to snatch away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: capio, prehendo, sumo, demo, adimo, rapio, furor). </sense><sense id="n16146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16146.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibias ex ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bolum e faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundines ex nido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>: ex manibus alicujus, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrem ab igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 579</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cb n="ERIS" /> aliena bona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vela, armamenta, copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgamenta hortorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver</tr>, <tr>set free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e manibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abydenos ex obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istum fortuna ex illo periculo eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: aliquem ex miseriis, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex media morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filium a morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam de manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum de vestra severitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ex severitate alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">83: aliquem malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:365 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 365 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erepto ex equo C. Flaminio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium isti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem Caesari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:111:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 111, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubinam militi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (aliquam) alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102 al.</bibl>—Less freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ereptis ab eo duabus legionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Trisensibus plus lucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:38:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 38, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16146.3" n="b" level="4"> With se, <hi rend="ital">to take one's self off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eos, ne causam diceret, se eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se latebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex manibus militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab illa miseria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 16, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sequentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se hosti fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se flammis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se servituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus humanis se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Prov. 8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Prov. 8, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16146.4" n="c" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lupo agnum eripere, for something difficult or impossible,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16146.5" n="B" level="2"> Pregn.: eripi, <hi rend="ital">to be snatched away by death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die suddenly</hi> (not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">fatis erepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis conjux ereptus in annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:316" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 316</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in flore aetatis ereptus rebus humanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux ereptura eum vitā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. 30, 5, 10.</sense><sense id="n16146.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snatch away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsiones omnes hoc verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem alicui ex ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primam vocem ab ore loquentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui jus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem (hostis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem hominis omnino aspiciendi (opp. suppeditare omnium rerum abundantiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem usum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semestre imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tetrarchiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui errorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:3:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui timorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: virginis pudorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelumque diemque Teucrorum ex oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 88</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum oculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora certa modosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocos, venerem, etc. (anni),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatibus omnem fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 283</bibl></cit>: fugam, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for se fuga, or for the simple rapere fugam, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 619</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: eripiunt flammae noctem, i. c. <hi rend="ital">light up the night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:281" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripuere oculos aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:501" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fluvius retro eripit,</quote> <trans><tr>turns back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 238</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with an <hi rend="ital">object clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse loqui eripitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis eriperes verbis mihi, sidera caeli Lucere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to persuade me that not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: vix tamen eripiam, velis quin, etc., <hi rend="ital">I shall scarcely hinder you from</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eris: <entryFree id="n16147" type="main" key="E^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/eris</foreign>, <sense id="n16147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of strife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 92" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erisichthon: <entryFree id="n16148" type="main" key="E^ri^sichthon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrĭsichthon</orth>, v. Erysichthon.</entryFree>
erisma: <entryFree id="n16149" type="greek" key="e^risma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrisma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/reisma</foreign>, <sense id="n16149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buttress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 18" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11, 6</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">heterocl. gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eris matorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>). <pb n="657" /> <cb n="EROS" /></sense></entryFree>
eristalis: <entryFree id="n16150" type="greek" key="e^rista^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕristălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl> (dub.—Jan. erythallis).</sense></entryFree>
erithace: <entryFree id="n16151" type="greek" key="e^ri^tha^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭthăce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)riqa/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n16151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bee-bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandarach</hi>, called also sandaraca and cerinthus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 7, § 17</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 316:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 316, 8</bibl> and 23, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
erithacus: <entryFree id="n16152" type="greek" key="e^ri^tha^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭthăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ri/qakos</foreign>, <sense id="n16152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erithales: <entryFree id="n16153" type="greek" key="e^ri^tha^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrĭthăles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)riqale/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little houseleek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eritudo: <entryFree id="n16154" type="gloss" key="eritu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eritūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">her-</orth>): servitudo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83, 1</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <sense id="n16154.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">eritudo dominatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> Gloss. p. 460</bibl></cit>; and: eritudo <foreign lang="greek">despotei/a</foreign>, Gloss. Labb. [erus = herus].</sense></entryFree>
erivo: <entryFree id="n16155" type="hapax" key="e_ri_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rīvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvias aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eriza: <entryFree id="n16156" type="main" key="E^riza"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕriza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/eriza</foreign>, <sense id="n16156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Magna Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16156.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrizēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Eriza</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erneum: <entryFree id="n16157" type="main" key="erne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ernĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cake baked in an earthen pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:81" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ero: <entryFree id="n16158" type="greek" key="e_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēro</orth>, v. 2. aero.</entryFree>
erodo: <entryFree id="n16159" type="main" key="e_ro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rōdo</orth>, <sense id="n16159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no perf.</hi>, <itype>rōsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to gnaw off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consume.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16159.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vites (animalia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 52, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. frondes, Col. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> 10, 323.—</sense><sense id="n16159.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16159.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to eat away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes, ferrum (aqua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 19, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16159.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in medic. lang., of <hi rend="ital">erosive</hi> remedies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 52, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:176" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 15, 46, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erogatio: <entryFree id="n16160" type="main" key="e_ro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erogo</etym>. <sense id="n16160.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribution</hi>: pecuniae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:14" default="NO">50, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 38, 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 77" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 77</bibl></cit>; so in the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:41:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:50 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 50 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n16160.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erogator: <entryFree id="n16161" type="main" key="e_ro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŏgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pays out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gives away</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus praestationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 38, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who gives her away in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erogatorius: <entryFree id="n16162" type="main" key="e_ro^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŏgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for distributing</hi> (water): <cit><quote lang="la">modulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 34" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erogito: <entryFree id="n16163" type="main" key="e_ro^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŏgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to find out by asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliquo, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:476" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 476</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui neque cujatis esset, unquam potuimus multa erogitantes sciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Tr. 625" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Tr. 625</bibl></cit> (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fragm. Trag. p. 217" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. p. 217</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
erogo: <entryFree id="n16164" type="main" key="e_ro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16164.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., a pub. law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to expend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay out</hi> money from the public treasury, after asking the consent of the people: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias ex aerario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 47 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in classem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde in eos sumptus, pecunia erogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 5, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16164.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the pub. law sphere, <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disburse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expend</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pendo, expendo, perpendo, pondero, solvo, luo): Tironem Curio commendes, ut ei, si quid opus erit, in sumptum eroget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in pretium servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona sua in fraudem futurae actionis,</quote> <trans><tr>to squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:68" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandem pecuniam in Tigellinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bequeath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiridatem erogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores, unguenta ad funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro introitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:102" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 1, 102 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16164.2" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in Tertullian: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to expose to death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot innocentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Praescript. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16164.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail on by entreaties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus erogatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eros: <entryFree id="n16165" type="main" key="E^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/erws</foreign>. <sense id="n16165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Love</hi> as a person; <cit><quote lang="la">Lat. Amor, Cupido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">lem.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n16165.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a common name of Roman slaves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">freedmen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16165.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an actor in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erosio: <entryFree id="n16166" type="main" key="e_ro_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērōsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erodo</etym>, <sense id="n16166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eating away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erosion</hi>, in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">genarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 34, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erosus: <entryFree id="n16167" type="main" key="e_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from erodo. <cb n="ERRO" /></entryFree>
erotema: <entryFree id="n16168" type="greek" key="e^ro_te_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrōtēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rw/thma</foreign>, <sense id="n16168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a question</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 524</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erotopaegnion: <entryFree id="n16169" type="main" key="E^ro_to^paegni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrōtŏpaegnĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rwtopai/gnion</foreign>, <sense id="n16169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a love song</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Esp. <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrōtopaegnia</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a book of poems</hi> by Laevius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erotundatus: <entryFree id="n16170" type="hapax" key="e_ro^tunda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŏtundātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [rotundo], <sense id="n16170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rounded off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">structura verborum (with levis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erotylus: <entryFree id="n16171" type="main" key="e^ro_ty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrōtylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)rwtu/los</foreign>, <sense id="n16171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
errabundus: <entryFree id="n16172" type="main" key="erra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>erro</etym>, <sense id="n16172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Caes.): odor,</quote> <trans><tr>floating about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc errabundi domos suos pervagarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves (with dispersae), Auct. B. Afr. 2, 4: naves vagabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trieris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia bovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
errantia: <entryFree id="n16173" type="hapax" key="errantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>: animi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 204, 13</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. p. 196</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
erraticus: <entryFree id="n16174" type="main" key="erra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erratic</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16174.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: stellae, <hi rend="ital">planets</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:11" default="NO">14, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18" default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>herpetic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 84, § 136</bibl></cit>; cf. transf.: vitis serpens multiplici lapsu et erratico, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16174.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in botany, of plants that spring up here and there wild, i. q. silvestris, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:12" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 2, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intubum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erratilis: <entryFree id="n16175" type="main" key="erra_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erratio: <entryFree id="n16176" type="main" key="erra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving about.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16176.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac multo propius ibis et minor est erratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16176.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in factis dictisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 17, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
errativus: <entryFree id="n16177" type="gloss" key="erra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātīvus</orth> (al. ERRATICIVS) animus est, qui solet errare et desinit, Fronto de Differ. Voc. p. 2200 P.</entryFree>
errator: <entryFree id="n16178" type="main" key="erra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wanderer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344:34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344, 34</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the river Maeander: <cit><quote lang="la">terris totiens crrator in isdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erratum: <entryFree id="n16179" type="main" key="erra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. erro, I. B. 2. b.</entryFree>
erratus: <entryFree id="n16180" type="main" key="erra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>erro</etym>, <sense id="n16180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving about</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">longis erratibus actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 567</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erro: <entryFree id="n16181" type="main" key="erro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">erro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root er-, to go; desiderative forms, <foreign lang="greek">e)/rxomai</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">e)rsk</foreign>-); and Lat. (ers-o) erro, to seek to reach; hence, to wander; cf. Germ. irren; Engl. err, etc., v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 546 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 546 sq.</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n16181.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16181.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n16181.3" n="1" level="3"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stray about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rove</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vagor, palor): propter te errans patria careo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vagus et exsul erraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignari hominumque locorumque Erramus vento huc et vastis fluctibus acti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 333</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl>; 3, 200; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:335" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 335</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">circum villulas nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pios per lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter audaces lupus errat agnos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of beasts,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 11</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male tum Libyae solis erratur in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 249</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in media luce errare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16181.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">(stellae) quae errantes et quasi vagae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the planets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the motion of the stars in gen.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocytus errans flumine languido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantesque per altum Cyaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:561" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic lintres errare videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ad frontem sparsos errare capillos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flying about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantia lumina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>moving fitfully about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 27</bibl></cit> (4, 13, 27 M.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:150" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmonibus errat Ignis edax,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spreads</tr>, <tr>runs about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 201</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16181.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stray at random</hi>: ne vagari et errare cogatur oratio, Cic. de Or., 48, 209; cf.: erraus et vaga <cb n="ERRO" /> sententia (opp. stabilis certaque), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo fit, ut errem et vager latius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingredi libere, non ut licenter videatur errare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errans opinio (opp. stabilis conscientia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubiis affectibus errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tuus erret honos,</quote> <trans><tr>be in doubt</tr>, <tr>uncertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 468</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:543" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 543</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erro, quam insistas viam,</quote> <trans><tr>I am uncertain</tr>, <tr>in doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 197</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter recens et vetus sacramentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hesitate</tr>, <tr>vacillate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16181.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to miss the right way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lose one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go astray</hi> (in the literal sense rarely, but in the trop. freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16181.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: homo qui erranti comiter monstrat viam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errare viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictus qui errare facit caecum in itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 27, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16181.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wander from the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to err</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avius errat Saepe animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 463</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 740</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā erras viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo non tu quidem totà re, sed temporibus errasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 38</bibl></cit> Kritz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errant probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">errare malo cum Platone quam cum istis vera sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erras, si id credis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 29, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de nostris verbis errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:21" default="NO">10, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81 al" default="NO">11, 1, 81 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alteram partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienos fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. with <case>acc.</case> of a neutr. pronoun: <cit><quote lang="la">mone, quaeso, si quid erro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">quid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:11" default="NO">2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:6" default="NO">2, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also with the <case>acc.</case> of a noun: <cit><quote lang="la">errabant tempora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in chronology</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:155" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 155</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fuit errandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil esset erratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si erratur in nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutius circa priores erratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno verbo esse erratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl></cit>. —Sometimes, in a palliative manner, of moral error, <hi rend="ital">to err through mistake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter te errantem et illum sceleratissimum persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 104:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 104, 4</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n16181.9" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">errātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud de Flavio et fastis, si secus est, commune erratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus errato nulla venia, recte facto exigua laus proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum ob totius vitae non dicam vitium, sed erratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 3, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16181.10" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> in Aug. poets (only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to wander over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum est erratas dicere terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:447" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 690</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16182" type="main" key="erro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">erro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. erro</etym>, <sense id="n16182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wanderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagabond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagrant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 53</bibl>.—Used esp. of slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">ut errones aliquem cujus dicantur invenient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; Edict. Aedil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4" default="NO">49, 16, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 113</bibl>.—Of the queen-bee: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —Of the planets, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:11" default="NO">14, 1, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Of vagabond soldiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nostros servire sinant errorribus agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Dir. 70</bibl></cit> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
erroneus: <entryFree id="n16183" type="main" key="erro_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">errōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagus atque erroneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: erroneus, <foreign lang="greek">a)lh/ths, pla/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</sense></entryFree>
error: <entryFree id="n16184" type="main" key="error"><orth extent="full" lang="la">error</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16184.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strolling about</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n16184.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos Ceres m illo errore venisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error ac dissipatio civium (sc. mercatorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit> Mos. (cf. erratio, I.): navium pars ex errore eodem conferebatur, Auct. B. Afr. 11; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 755</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 532</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">motion</hi> of atoms, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 132</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">meanderings</hi> of rivers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 582</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">mazes</hi> of the labyrinth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 161</bibl>; 167.—</sense><sense id="n16184.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuat incertis erroribus ardor amantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1077" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1077</bibl></cit>: <pb n="658" /> <cb n="ERUC" /> nec, quid corde nunc consili capere possim, Scio, tantus cum cura meo est error animo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:362 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 362 al.</bibl>; so, too, with <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <trans><tr>uncertainty</tr>, <tr>ignorance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16184.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a wandering from the right way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a going astray.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16184.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">reduxit me usque ex errore in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16184.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a departing from the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusion</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erratum, vitium, peccatum): erroris ego illos et. dementiae complebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionibus vulgi rapimur in errorem nec vera cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inducere imperitos in errorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errore quodam fallimur in disputando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si errorem velis tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 140</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>distraction</tr>, <tr>insanity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 454</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 513</bibl>; so <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of other kinds of mental perturbation, as fear, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:555" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 555</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">love,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 342</bibl>: aut aliquis latet error; <cit><quote lang="la">equo ne credite, Teucri,</quote> <trans><tr>some deception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">par forma aut aetas errorem agnoscentibus fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum detulit error in Idam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16184.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an error in language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solecism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16184.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Rarely a moral <hi rend="ital">error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi> (cf. erro, I. B. 2.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 8, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; 2, 3, 92.— </sense><sense id="n16184.9" n="(d)" level="5"> Error, <hi rend="ital">personif.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ath</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inspirer of folly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judicial blindness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erubescentia: <entryFree id="n16185" type="main" key="e_ru^bescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭbescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erubesco</etym>, <sense id="n16185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blushing for shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamefacedness</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Poen. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erubescibilis: <entryFree id="n16186" type="main" key="e_ru^besci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭbescĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of which one should be ashamed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
