erubesco: <entryFree id="n16187" type="main" key="e_ru^besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŭbesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16187.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to redden.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16187.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi te totis erubuisse genis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 330</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 1, 36</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16187.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blush with shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feel ashamed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16187.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, with <hi rend="ital">praepp.</hi> or <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">erubui mecastor misera propter clamorem tuum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (voluptates) non erubescens persequitur nominatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 111 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 16, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 584</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 168</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:64 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 64 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sorore multum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 25</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16187.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (postAug. and freq.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 50</bibl>, pudet enim loqui is the true reading): <cit><quote lang="la">noli erubescere collegam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO">6, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16187.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura fidemque Supplicis erubuit,</quote> <trans><tr>he respected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans><tr>to blush on account of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 13, 20 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">soloecismum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 9</bibl></cit> (dub. al. soloecismo).—In the <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi> erubescendus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">of which one should be ashamed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes (amoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id urbi Romanae fore erubescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:59:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 59, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:21:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni domesticis cladibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eruca: <entryFree id="n16188" type="main" key="e_ru_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n16188.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A caterpillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cankerworm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:63, p. 464" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 63, p. 464</bibl> Bip.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35</bibl> saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:333" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 229</bibl>, but here Sillig reads uruca, q. v.—</sense><sense id="n16188.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of cole-wort</hi>, Brassica eruca, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:109" default="NO">10, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:372" default="NO">372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:75" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erucius: <entryFree id="n16189" type="main" key="Erucius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Erucius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eructatio: <entryFree id="n16190" type="main" key="e_ructa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēructātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eructo</etym>, <sense id="n16190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throwing upward</hi> (post-class. and rare): altera (exhalatio) arida est atque animae similis, quae terrenis eructationibus surgit, App. de Mundo, p. 60, 40.—</sense><sense id="n16190.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an utterance</hi>: judiciorum Dei per voces prophetarum, Hilar. in Psa. 41, 12.</sense></entryFree>
eructo: <entryFree id="n16191" type="main" key="e_ructo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-ructo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16191.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To belch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vomit forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw up</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n16191.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tu nos turpissime eructando ejecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: saniem eructans, <cb n="ERUD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 632</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16191.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem sermonibus suis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to talk of murder when drunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16191.3" n="II" level="1"> Ingen., <hi rend="ital">to cast forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartarus horriferos eructans faucibus aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1012" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1012</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxium virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas, vaporem, fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16191.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to utter</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">abscondita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 18, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eructus: <entryFree id="n16192" type="main" key="e_ructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. ‡ 2. erugo.</entryFree>
erudero: <entryFree id="n16193" type="main" key="e_ru_de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rūdĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n16193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to clear from rubbish</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16193.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16193.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen de supervacuis sententiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 22, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erudio: <entryFree id="n16194" type="main" key="e_ru^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŭdĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, qs. to free from roughness, i. e. <sense id="n16194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teach</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: doceo, edoceo, praecipio, instituo). </sense><sense id="n16194.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosos discendi erudiunt atque docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2</bibl></cit> (with docere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 35</bibl> (with instituere); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; Quint. prooem. § 1; <cit><quote lang="la">6 et saep.: filios ad majorum instituta (with instituere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ad exquisitissimam consuetudinem Graecorum erudiit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem leges praeceptaque belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:507" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:50" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 50</bibl>; v. also under <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: aliquem, with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">without aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:820" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 820</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:352" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 352</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">qua possint arte capi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:294" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tirones neque in ludo, neque per lanistas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cause to be instructed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores sub eodem magistro eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenas erudiendi gratia missus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">once: aliquem de aliqua re, Cic.: obviae mihi velim sint tuae litterae, quae me erudiant de omni re publica,</quote> <trans><tr>instruct me</tr>, <tr>keep me informed of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of objects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut flerent, oculos erudiere suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 690</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polycletus consummasse hanc scientiam judicatur et toreuticen sic erudisse, ut Phidias aperuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have cultivated</tr>, <tr>brought to perfection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-informed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi> (cf.: litteratus, doctus, peritus, gnarus, scitus). </sense><sense id="n16194.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">est non satis politus iis artibus, quas qui tenent eruditi appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeculus otiosus et loquax, et fortasse doctus atque eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper mihi et doctrina et eruditi homines placuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sicut vulgus sed ut eruditi solent appellare sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. rusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:75" default="NO">8, 6, 75</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non transmarinis nec importatis artibus eruditi, sed genuinis domesticisque virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines non litteris ad rei militaris scientiam, sed rebus gestis ac victoriis eruditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditi Socraticis disputationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueris eruditi artibus militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris eruditior quam Curio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaevola, homo omnium et disciplina juris civilis eruditissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 180</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecas res eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 9</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus utilia honestis miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16194.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ceteri minus eruditis hominum seculis fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora (with docti homines),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: oratio (opp. popularis), id. Par. prooem. § 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24 al" default="NO">8, 6, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum copia,</quote> <trans><tr>fulness of Greek learning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: palata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi> (with docta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex historia ducere urbanitatem, eruditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditissimum longe, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 97</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">learnedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eruditely.</hi>— <cb n="ERUM" /> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 36</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eruditio: <entryFree id="n16195" type="main" key="e_ru^di_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>erudio</etym>, <sense id="n16195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instructing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi> (cf.: doctrina, disciplina, scientia, intellegentia, cognitio). </sense><sense id="n16195.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejus eruditione quod labores, nihil est, quoniam ingenium ejus nosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16195.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erudition</hi>, obtained by instruction: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praeclara eruditione atque doctrina aut utraque re ornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO">6, 3, 17</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; Gell. praef. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
eruditor: <entryFree id="n16196" type="main" key="e_ru^di_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instructor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>; Hier. Vit. Hil.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 2, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eruditrix: <entryFree id="n16197" type="hapax" key="e_ru^di_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eruditor</etym>, <sense id="n16197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instructress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:38" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eruditulus: <entryFree id="n16198" type="hapax" key="e_ru^di_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. eruditus</etym>, <sense id="n16198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat skilled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi> (in love), said jocosely, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 57, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eruditus: <entryFree id="n16199" type="main" key="e_ru^di_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from erudio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16200" type="hapax" key="e_ru^di_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērŭdītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>erudio</etym>, <sense id="n16200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instruction;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, Tert, adv. Val. 29.</sense></entryFree>
erugatio: <entryFree id="n16201" type="hapax" key="e_ru_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ērūgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. erugo</etym>, <sense id="n16201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clearing from wrinkles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erugo: <entryFree id="n16202" type="main" key="e_ru_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rūgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clear from wrinkles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:127" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 74, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 50, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16203" type="gloss" key="e_ru_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rūgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, semel factum significat, quod eructare saepius</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83, 1</bibl> Müll.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belched out;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum (with fetidum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erulus: <entryFree id="n16204" type="main" key="Eru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Erŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Herulus.</entryFree>
erumpo: <entryFree id="n16205" type="main" key="e_rumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n16205.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst forth; to burst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunder</hi> (rare; mostly ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n16205.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(brassica) tumida concoquit, eadem erumpit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 725</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 583</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achates et Aeneas erumpere nubem ardebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sanguis eruptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl></cit>: se erumpere, in the neuter signif., <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1111</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">portis se foras erumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et caput, unde altus primum se erumpit Enipeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 368</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16205.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in me stomachum erumpant, cum sint tibi irati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iram in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: sic illi invidiosa conjunctio ad bellum se erupit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 88</bibl>.—Far more frequent and class., </sense><sense id="n16205.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sally forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16205.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16205.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes ex Aetnae vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ex stagno amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quo loco erumperent Pompeiani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 99:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 99, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive noctu, sive interdiu erumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 2</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 33 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit, excessit, evasit, erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>to break through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter tela hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Catilinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 43, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16205.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to burst forth</hi> in growing, <hi rend="ital">to shoot up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium e latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentor cortice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16205.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burst forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illa conjuratio ex latebris atque ex tenebris erupisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illustrantur, si erumpunt omnia?</quote> <trans><tr>are disclosed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex media (oratione) erumpit,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks away</tr>, <tr>digresses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus quo pacto ita repente erumpat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:de Or. 2:58:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 235</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando vera vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Phil. 10:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba vi quadam veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curae privatae in certaminibus publicis erumpebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 24, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen dicendi per obstantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut odia occulta civium in fortunas optimi cujusque erumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl>; so, vitia in amicos, id. Lael <pb n="659" /> <cb n="ERUS" /> 21: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspirationes in rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne istaec fortitudo in nervum erumpat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>may end in bringing you to the stocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in omnium perniciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae per hoc triennium agitata sunt, in hos dies, in hos menses, in hoc tempus erumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elisa (vox) in illum sonum erumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem voluptatis affectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO">11, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omne genus crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cal. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad ultimum seditionis erupturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majora vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsus (dominatio) eruptura sit horremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc ejus affectus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erunco: <entryFree id="n16206" type="main" key="e_runco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-runco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weed out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">areas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eruo: <entryFree id="n16207" type="main" key="e_ru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-rŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ŭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw out; to dig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pluck out</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16207.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sciet, ubi quidque positum sit, quaque eo veniat, is, etiam si quid obrutum erit, poterit eruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurum terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caprificos sepulcris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem ab radicibus imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 320</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pinum radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 449</bibl></cit> Heyne <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam radicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 50, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:114" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 29, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes de sinistra parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam remis,</quote> <trans><tr>lo stir up</tr>, <tr>plough up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra (hyaena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">eruitur oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>his eyes are torn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 269</bibl></cit> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 458).—</sense><sense id="n16207.3" n="B" level="2"> Since the Aug. per., sometimes, in partic., <hi rend="ital">to root out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy from the foundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem totam a sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 612</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl>; cf. under II. B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n16207.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16207.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elicit</hi>: inde tamen aliquando (servum fugitivum) eruam, Vat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutari locos, ex quibus argumenta eruamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est, quod indagaris, inveneris, ex tenebris erueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex annalium vetustate eruenda est memoria nobilitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam rerum et rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 4, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra recognosces annalibus eruta priscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi sicunde potes, erues, qui decem legati Mummio fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 30, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: fanum erui volo; <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc mihi erui potest,</quote> <trans><tr>I cannot be talked out of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16207.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16207.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rescue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter difficultatem pecuniariam, qua erui nusquam nisi ex privatorum bonis posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16207.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojanas ut opes et lamentabile regnum Eruerint Danai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracas (with frangere gentem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
